signal.name: AdwAboutDialog::activate-link
signal.description:
Emitted when a URL is activated.
Applications may connect to it to override the default behavior, which is to call [func@Gtk.show_uri].
Since: 1.5
signal.return: `TRUE` if the link has been activated

signal.name: AdwAboutWindow::activate-link
signal.description:
Emitted when a URL is activated.
Applications may connect to it to override the default behavior, which is to call [func@Gtk.show_uri].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].
signal.return: `TRUE` if the link has been activated

enum.name: AdwAccentColor
enum.description:
Describes the available system accent colors.
Since: 1.6

parameter.name: ADW_ACCENT_COLOR_BLUE
parameter.parameter_description: Use a blue color (`#3584e4`). This is the default value.

signal.name: AdwActionRow::activated
signal.description: This signal is emitted after the row has been activated.

signal.name: AdwAlertDialog::response
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the dialog is closed.
@response will be set to the response ID of the button that had been activated.
if the dialog was closed by pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd> or with a system action, @response will be set to the value of [property@AlertDialog:close-response].
Since: 1.5

signal.name: AdwAnimation::done
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the animation has been completed, either on its own or via calling [method@Animation.skip].

enum.name: AdwAnimationState
enum.description:
Describes the possible states of an [class@Animation].
The state can be controlled with [method@Animation.play], [method@Animation.pause], [method@Animation.resume], [method@Animation.reset] and [method@Animation.skip].

signal.name: AdwBanner::button-clicked
signal.description:
This signal is emitted after the action button has been clicked.
It can be used as an alternative to setting an action.
Since: 1.3

enum.name: AdwBannerButtonStyle
enum.description:
Describes the available button styles for [class@Banner].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
See [property@Banner:button-style].
Since: 1.7

parameter.name: ADW_BANNER_BUTTON_SUGGESTED
parameter.parameter_description: A button in the suggested action style.

signal.name: AdwBottomSheet::close-attempt
signal.description:
Emitted when the close button or shortcut is used while [property@Dialog:can-close] is set to `FALSE`.
Since: 1.6

signal.name: AdwBreakpoint::apply
signal.description:
Emitted when the breakpoint is applied.
This signal is emitted after the setters have been applied.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwBreakpoint::unapply
signal.description:
Emitted when the breakpoint is unapplied.
This signal is emitted before resetting the setter values.
Since: 1.4

enum.name: AdwBreakpointConditionLengthType
enum.description:
Describes length types for [struct@BreakpointCondition].
See [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_length].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MIN_WIDTH
parameter.parameter_description: true if the width is greater than or equal to the condition value

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MAX_WIDTH
parameter.parameter_description: true if the width is less than or equal to the condition value

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MIN_HEIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: true if the height is greater than or equal to the condition value

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MAX_HEIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: true if the height is less than or equal to the condition value

enum.name: AdwBreakpointConditionRatioType
enum.description:
Describes ratio types for [struct@BreakpointCondition].
See [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_ratio].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO
parameter.parameter_description: true if the aspect ratio is greater than or equal to the condition value

parameter.name: ADW_BREAKPOINT_CONDITION_MAX_ASPECT_RATIO
parameter.parameter_description: true if the aspect ratio is less than or equal to the condition value

signal.name: AdwButtonRow::activated
signal.description:
This signal is emitted after the row has been activated.
Since: 1.6

signal.name: AdwCarousel::page-changed
signal.description:
This signal is emitted after a page has been changed.
It can be used to implement "infinite scrolling" by amending the pages after every scroll.
::: note An empty carousel is indicated by `(int)index == -1`.

enum.name: AdwCenteringPolicy
enum.description: Describes title centering behavior of a [class@HeaderBar] widget.

parameter.name: ADW_CENTERING_POLICY_LOOSE
parameter.parameter_description: Keep the title centered when possible

parameter.name: ADW_CENTERING_POLICY_STRICT
parameter.parameter_description: Keep the title centered at all cost

enum.name: AdwColorScheme
enum.description: Application color schemes for [property@StyleManager:color-scheme].

parameter.name: ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: Inherit the parent color-scheme. When set on the `AdwStyleManager` returned by [func@StyleManager.get_default], it's equivalent to `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_LIGHT`.

parameter.name: ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_LIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Use light appearance unless the system prefers dark colors.

parameter.name: ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_DARK
parameter.parameter_description: Use dark appearance unless the system prefers prefers light colors.

signal.name: AdwDialog::close-attempt
signal.description:
Emitted when the close button or shortcut is used, or [method@Dialog.close] is called while [property@Dialog:can-close] is set to `FALSE`.
Since: 1.5

signal.name: AdwDialog::closed
signal.description:
Emitted when the dialog is successfully closed.
Since: 1.5

enum.name: AdwDialogPresentationMode
enum.description:
Describes the available presentation modes for [class@Dialog].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
See [property@Dialog:presentation-mode].
Since: 1.5

parameter.name: ADW_DIALOG_AUTO
parameter.parameter_description: Switch between `ADW_DIALOG_FLOATING` and `ADW_DIALOG_BOTTOM_SHEET` depending on available size.

parameter.name: ADW_DIALOG_FLOATING
parameter.parameter_description: Present dialog as a centered floating window.

parameter.name: ADW_DIALOG_BOTTOM_SHEET
parameter.parameter_description: Present dialog as a bottom sheet.

enum.name: AdwEasing
enum.description:
Describes the available easing functions for use with [class@TimedAnimation].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_ELASTIC
parameter.parameter_description: Elastic tweening, with offshoot on start.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_OUT_ELASTIC
parameter.parameter_description: Elastic tweening, with offshoot on end, inverse of `ADW_EASE_IN_ELASTIC`.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_OUT_ELASTIC
parameter.parameter_description: Elastic tweening, with offshoot on both ends, combining `ADW_EASE_IN_ELASTIC` and `ADW_EASE_OUT_ELASTIC`.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_BACK
parameter.parameter_description: Overshooting cubic tweening, with backtracking on start.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_OUT_BACK
parameter.parameter_description: Overshooting cubic tweening, with backtracking on end, inverse of `ADW_EASE_IN_BACK`.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_OUT_BACK
parameter.parameter_description: Overshooting cubic tweening, with backtracking on both ends, combining `ADW_EASE_IN_BACK` and `ADW_EASE_OUT_BACK`.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_BOUNCE
parameter.parameter_description: Exponentially decaying parabolic (bounce) tweening, on start.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_OUT_BOUNCE
parameter.parameter_description: Exponentially decaying parabolic (bounce) tweening, with bounce on end, inverse of `ADW_EASE_IN_BOUNCE`.

parameter.name: ADW_EASE_IN_OUT_BOUNCE
parameter.parameter_description: Exponentially decaying parabolic (bounce) tweening, with bounce on both ends, combining `ADW_EASE_IN_BOUNCE` and `ADW_EASE_OUT_BOUNCE`.

signal.name: AdwEntryRow::apply
signal.description:
Emitted when the apply button is pressed.
See [property@EntryRow:show-apply-button].
Since: 1.2

signal.name: AdwEntryRow::entry-activated
signal.description:
Emitted when the embedded entry is activated.
Since: 1.2

enum.name: AdwFlapFoldPolicy
enum.description:
Describes the possible folding behavior of a [class@Flap] widget.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

parameter.name: ADW_FLAP_FOLD_POLICY_NEVER
parameter.parameter_description: Disable folding, the flap cannot reach narrow sizes.

parameter.name: ADW_FLAP_FOLD_POLICY_AUTO
parameter.parameter_description: Fold and unfold the flap based on available space.

enum.name: AdwFlapTransitionType
enum.description:
Describes transitions types of a [class@Flap] widget.
It determines the type of animation when transitioning between children in a [class@Flap] widget, as well as which areas can be swiped via [property@Flap:swipe-to-open] and [property@Flap:swipe-to-close].
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

parameter.name: ADW_FLAP_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER
parameter.parameter_description: The flap slides over the content, which is dimmed. When folded, only the flap can be swiped.

parameter.name: ADW_FLAP_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER
parameter.parameter_description: The content slides over the flap. Only the content can be swiped.

parameter.name: ADW_FLAP_TRANSITION_TYPE_SLIDE
parameter.parameter_description: The flap slides offscreen when hidden, neither the flap nor content overlap each other. Both widgets can be swiped.

enum.name: AdwFoldThresholdPolicy
enum.description:
Determines when [class@Flap] and [class@Leaflet] will fold.
Deprecated: 1.4: Stop using `AdwLeaflet` and `AdwFlap`

parameter.name: ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_MINIMUM
parameter.parameter_description: Folding is based on the minimum size

parameter.name: ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_NATURAL
parameter.parameter_description: Folding is based on the natural size

enum.name: AdwInlineViewSwitcherDisplayMode
enum.description: Describes what [class@InlineViewSwitcher] toggles display. Since: 1.7

parameter.name: ADW_INLINE_VIEW_SWITCHER_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: Toggles display both icons and labels.

enum.name: AdwJustifyMode
enum.description:
Describes line justify behaviors in a [class@WrapLayout] or [class@WrapBox].
See [property@WrapLayout:justify] and [property@WrapBox:justify].
Since: 1.7

parameter.name: ADW_JUSTIFY_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Don't justify children within a line.

parameter.name: ADW_JUSTIFY_FILL
parameter.parameter_description: Stretch each child within the line, keeping consistent spacing, so that the line fills the entire length.

parameter.name: ADW_JUSTIFY_SPREAD
parameter.parameter_description: Increase spacing between children, moving the children so that the first and last child are aligned with the beginning and end of the line. If the line only contains a single widget, it will be stretched regardless.

enum.name: AdwLeafletTransitionType
enum.description:
Describes the possible transitions in a [class@Leaflet] widget.
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

parameter.name: ADW_LEAFLET_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER
parameter.parameter_description: Cover the old page or uncover the new page, sliding from or towards the end according to orientation, text direction and children order

parameter.name: ADW_LEAFLET_TRANSITION_TYPE_UNDER
parameter.parameter_description: Uncover the new page or cover the old page, sliding from or towards the start according to orientation, text direction and children order

parameter.name: ADW_LEAFLET_TRANSITION_TYPE_SLIDE
parameter.parameter_description: Slide from left, right, up or down according to the orientation, text direction and the children order

enum.name: AdwLengthUnit
enum.description:
Describes length units.
| Unit | Regular Text | Large Text | | ---- | ------------ | ---------- | | 1px | 1px | 1px | | 1pt | 1.333333px | 1.666667px | | 1sp | 1px | 1.25px |
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: ADW_LENGTH_UNIT_PT
parameter.parameter_description: points, changes with text scale factor

parameter.name: ADW_LENGTH_UNIT_SP
parameter.parameter_description: scale independent pixels, changes with text scale factor

signal.name: AdwMessageDialog::response
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the dialog is closed.
@response will be set to the response ID of the button that had been activated.
if the dialog was closed by pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd> or with a system action, @response will be set to the value of [property@MessageDialog:close-response].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

enum.name: AdwNavigationDirection
enum.description: Describes the direction of a swipe navigation gesture.

parameter.name: ADW_NAVIGATION_DIRECTION_BACK
parameter.parameter_description: Corresponds to start or top, depending on orientation and text direction

parameter.name: ADW_NAVIGATION_DIRECTION_FORWARD
parameter.parameter_description: Corresponds to end or bottom, depending on orientation and text direction

signal.name: AdwNavigationPage::hidden
signal.description:
Emitted when the navigation view transition has been completed and the page is fully hidden.
It will always be preceded by [signal@NavigationPage::hiding] or [signal@NavigationPage::showing].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPage::hiding
signal.description:
Emitted when the page starts hiding at the beginning of the navigation view transition.
It will always be followed by [signal@NavigationPage::hidden] or [signal@NavigationPage::shown].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPage::showing
signal.description:
Emitted when the page shows at the beginning of the navigation view transition.
It will always be followed by [signal@NavigationPage::shown] or [signal@NavigationPage::hidden].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPage::shown
signal.description:
Emitted when the navigation view transition has been completed and the page is fully shown.
It will always be preceded by [signal@NavigationPage::showing] or [signal@NavigationPage::hiding].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPageClass::hidden
signal.description:
Called when the navigation view transition has been completed and the page is fully hidden.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPageClass::hiding
signal.description:
Called when the page starts hiding at the beginning of the navigation view transition.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPageClass::showing
signal.description:
Called when the page shows at the beginning of the navigation view transition.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationPageClass::shown
signal.description:
Called when the navigation view transition has been completed and the page is fully shown.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationView::get-next-page
signal.description:
Emitted when a push shortcut or a gesture is triggered.
To support the push shortcuts and gestures, the application is expected to return the page to push in the handler.
This signal can be emitted multiple times for the gestures, for example when the gesture is cancelled by the user. As such, the application must not make any irreversible changes in the handler, such as removing the page from a forward stack.
Instead, it should be done in the [signal@NavigationView::pushed] handler.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationView::popped
signal.description:
Emitted after @page has been popped from the navigation stack.
See [method@NavigationView.pop].
When using [method@NavigationView.pop_to_page] or [method@NavigationView.pop_to_tag], this signal is emitted for each of the popped pages.
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationView::pushed
signal.description:
Emitted after a page has been pushed to the navigation stack.
See [method@NavigationView.push].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwNavigationView::replaced
signal.description:
Emitted after the navigation stack has been replaced.
See [method@NavigationView.replace].
Since: 1.4

enum.name: AdwPackDirection
enum.description:
Describes child packing behavior in a [class@WrapLayout] or [class@WrapBox].
See [property@WrapLayout:pack-direction] and [property@WrapBox:pack-direction].
Since: 1.7

parameter.name: ADW_PACK_START_TO_END
parameter.parameter_description: Pack children from left to right for LTR languages, or top to bottom vertically.

parameter.name: ADW_PACK_END_TO_START
parameter.parameter_description: Pack children from right to left for LTR languages, or bottom to top vertically.

enum.name: AdwResponseAppearance
enum.description:
Describes the possible styles of [class@AlertDialog] response buttons.
See [method@AlertDialog.set_response_appearance].
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: ADW_RESPONSE_SUGGESTED
parameter.parameter_description: used to denote important responses such as the affirmative action.

parameter.name: ADW_RESPONSE_DESTRUCTIVE
parameter.parameter_description: used to draw attention to the potentially damaging consequences of using the response. This appearance acts as a warning to the user.

signal.name: AdwSpinRow::input
signal.description:
Emitted to convert the user's input into a double value.
The signal handler is expected to use [method@Gtk.Editable.get_text] to retrieve the text of the spinbutton and set new_value to the new value.
The default conversion uses [func@GLib.strtod].
See [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::input].
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: new_value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the new value

signal.return: `TRUE` for a successful conversion, `FALSE` if the input was not handled, and `GTK_INPUT_ERROR` if the conversion failed.

signal.name: AdwSpinRow::output
signal.description:
Emitted to tweak the formatting of the value for display.
See [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::output].
Since: 1.4
signal.return: `TRUE` if the value has been displayed

signal.name: AdwSpinRow::wrapped
signal.description:
Emitted right after the spinbutton wraps.
See [signal@Gtk.SpinButton::wrapped].
Since: 1.4

signal.name: AdwSplitButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted to animate press then release.
This is an action signal. Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the [signal@SplitButton::clicked] signal.

signal.name: AdwSplitButton::clicked
signal.description: Emitted when the button has been activated (pressed and released).

enum.name: AdwSqueezerTransitionType
enum.description:
Describes the possible transitions in a [class@Squeezer] widget.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

signal.name: AdwSwipeTracker::begin-swipe
signal.description: This signal is emitted right before a swipe will be started, after the drag threshold has been passed.

signal.name: AdwSwipeTracker::end-swipe
signal.description:
This signal is emitted as soon as the gesture has stopped.
The user is expected to animate the deceleration from the current progress value to @to with an animation using @velocity as the initial velocity, provided in pixels per second. [class@SpringAnimation] is usually a good fit for this.

parameter.name: to
parameter.parameter_description: the progress value to animate to

signal.name: AdwSwipeTracker::prepare
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when a possible swipe is detected.
The @direction value can be used to restrict the swipe to a certain direction.

signal.name: AdwSwipeTracker::update-swipe
signal.description: This signal is emitted every time the progress value changes.

signal.name: AdwTabBar::extra-drag-drop
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when content is dropped onto a tab.
The content must be of one of the types set up via [method@TabBar.setup_extra_drop_target].
See [signal@Gtk.DropTarget::drop].

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the page matching the tab the content was dropped onto

signal.return: whether the drop was accepted for @page

signal.name: AdwTabBar::extra-drag-value
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the dropped content is preloaded.
In order for data to be preloaded, [property@TabBar:extra-drag-preload] must be set to `TRUE`.
The content must be of one of the types set up via [method@TabBar.setup_extra_drop_target].
See [property@Gtk.DropTarget:value].
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the page matching the tab the content was dropped onto

signal.return: the preferred action for the drop on @page

signal.name: AdwTabButton::activate
signal.description:
Emitted to animate press then release.
This is an action signal. Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the [signal@TabButton::clicked] signal.
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AdwTabButton::clicked
signal.description:
Emitted when the button has been activated (pressed and released).
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: AdwTabOverview::create-tab
signal.description:
Emitted when a tab needs to be created.
This can happen after the new tab button has been pressed, see [property@TabOverview:enable-new-tab].
The signal handler is expected to create a new page in the corresponding [class@TabView] and return it.
Since: 1.3

signal.name: AdwTabOverview::extra-drag-drop
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when content is dropped onto a tab.
The content must be of one of the types set up via [method@TabOverview.setup_extra_drop_target].
See [signal@Gtk.DropTarget::drop].
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the page matching the tab the content was dropped onto

signal.return: whether the drop was accepted for @page

signal.name: AdwTabOverview::extra-drag-value
signal.description:
This signal is emitted when the dropped content is preloaded.
In order for data to be preloaded, [property@TabOverview:extra-drag-preload] must be set to `TRUE`.
The content must be of one of the types set up via [method@TabOverview.setup_extra_drop_target].
See [property@Gtk.DropTarget:value].
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the page matching the tab the content was dropped onto

signal.return: the preferred action for the drop on @page

signal.name: AdwTabView::close-page
signal.description:
Emitted after [method@TabView.close_page] has been called for @page.
The handler is expected to call [method@TabView.close_page_finish] to confirm or reject the closing.
The default handler will immediately confirm closing for non-pinned pages, or reject it for pinned pages, equivalent to the following example:
```c static gboolean close_page_cb (AdwTabView *view, AdwTabPage *page, gpointer user_data) { adw_tab_view_close_page_finish (view, page, !adw_tab_page_get_pinned (page));
return GDK_EVENT_STOP; } ```
The [method@TabView.close_page_finish] call doesn't have to happen inside the handler, so can be used to do asynchronous checks before confirming the closing.
A typical reason to connect to this signal is to show a confirmation dialog for closing a tab.
The signal handler should return `GDK_EVENT_STOP` to stop propagation or `GDK_EVENT_CONTINUE` to invoke the default handler.

signal.name: AdwTabView::create-window
signal.description:
Emitted when a tab should be transferred into a new window.
This can happen after a tab has been dropped on desktop.
The signal handler is expected to create a new window, position it as needed and return its `AdwTabView` that the page will be transferred into.

signal.name: AdwTabView::indicator-activated
signal.description:
Emitted after the indicator icon on @page has been activated.
See [property@TabPage:indicator-icon] and [property@TabPage:indicator-activatable].

signal.name: AdwTabView::page-attached
signal.description:
Emitted when a page has been created or transferred to @self.
A typical reason to connect to this signal would be to connect to page signals for things such as updating window title.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the page, starting from 0

signal.name: AdwTabView::page-detached
signal.description:
Emitted when a page has been removed or transferred to another view.
A typical reason to connect to this signal would be to disconnect signal handlers connected in the [signal@TabView::page-attached] handler.
It is important not to try and destroy the page child in the handler of this function as the child might merely be moved to another window; use child dispose handler for that or do it in sync with your [method@TabView.close_page_finish] calls.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the removed page, starting from 0

signal.name: AdwTabView::page-reordered
signal.description: Emitted after @page has been reordered to @position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position @page was moved to, starting at 0

signal.name: AdwTabView::setup-menu
signal.description:
Emitted when a context menu is opened or closed for @page.
If the menu has been closed, @page will be set to `NULL`.
It can be used to set up menu actions before showing the menu, for example disable actions not applicable to @page.

enum.name: AdwTabViewShortcuts
enum.description:
Describes available shortcuts in an [class@TabView].
Shortcuts can be set with [property@TabView:shortcuts], or added/removed individually with [method@TabView.add_shortcuts] and [method@TabView.remove_shortcuts].
New values may be added to this enumeration over time.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_PAGE_UP
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Page Up</kbd> - switch to the previous page

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_PAGE_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Page Down</kbd> - switch to the next page

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_SHIFT_PAGE_UP
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Page Up</kbd> - move the selected page backward

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_SHIFT_PAGE_DOWN
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Page Down</kbd> - move the selected page forward

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_SHIFT_HOME
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Home</kbd> - move the selected page at the start

parameter.name: ADW_TAB_VIEW_SHORTCUT_CONTROL_SHIFT_END
parameter.parameter_description: <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>End</kbd> - move the current page at the end

signal.name: AdwToast::button-clicked
signal.description:
Emitted after the button has been clicked.
It can be used as an alternative to setting an action.
Since: 1.2

signal.name: AdwToast::dismissed
signal.description: Emitted when the toast has been dismissed.

enum.name: AdwToastPriority
enum.description: [class@Toast] behavior when another toast is already displayed.

parameter.name: ADW_TOAST_PRIORITY_NORMAL
parameter.parameter_description: the toast will be queued if another toast is already displayed.

parameter.name: ADW_TOAST_PRIORITY_HIGH
parameter.parameter_description: the toast will be displayed immediately, pushing the previous toast into the queue instead.

enum.name: AdwToolbarStyle
enum.description: Describes the possible top or bottom bar styles in an [class@ToolbarView] widget. `ADW_TOOLBAR_FLAT` is suitable for simple content, such as [class@StatusPage] or [class@PreferencesPage], where the background at the top and bottom parts of the page is uniform. Additionally, windows with sidebars should always use this style. `ADW_TOOLBAR_RAISED` style is suitable for content such as [utility panes](https://developer.gnome.org/hig/patterns/containers/utility-panes.html), where some elements are directly adjacent to the top/bottom bars, or [class@TabView], where each page can have a different background. `ADW_TOOLBAR_RAISED_BORDER` style is similar to `ADW_TOOLBAR_RAISED`, but with the shadow replaced with a more subtle border. It's intended to be used in applications like image viewers, where a shadow over the content might be undesired. See [property@ToolbarView:top-bar-style] and [property@ToolbarView:bottom-bar-style]. New values may be added to this enumeration over time. Since: 1.4

parameter.name: ADW_TOOLBAR_FLAT
parameter.parameter_description: No background, shadow only for scrolled content

parameter.name: ADW_TOOLBAR_RAISED
parameter.parameter_description: Opaque background with a persistent shadow

parameter.name: ADW_TOOLBAR_RAISED_BORDER
parameter.parameter_description: Opaque background with a persistent border

enum.name: AdwViewSwitcherPolicy
enum.description: Describes the adaptive modes of [class@ViewSwitcher].

enum.name: AdwWrapPolicy
enum.description:
Describes line wrapping behavior in a [class@WrapLayout] or [class@WrapBox].
See [property@WrapLayout:wrap-policy] and [property@WrapBox:wrap-policy].
Since: 1.7

parameter.name: ADW_WRAP_NATURAL
parameter.parameter_description: Wrap to the next line as soon as the previous line cannot fit any more children without shrinking them past their natural size.

parameter.name: ADW_WRAP_MINIMUM
parameter.parameter_description: Fit as many children into each line as possible, shrinking them down to their minimum size before wrapping to the next line.

function.name: adw_about_dialog_add_acknowledgement_section
function.description:
Adds a section to the Acknowledgements page.
This can be used to acknowledge additional people and organizations for their non-development contributions - for example, backers in a crowdfunded project.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_add_credit_section
function.description:
Adds an extra section to the Credits page.
Extra sections are displayed below the standard categories.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_add_legal_section
function.description:
Adds an extra section to the Legal page.
Extra sections will be displayed below the application's own information.
The parameters @copyright, @license_type and @license will be used to present the it the same way as [property@AboutDialog:copyright], [property@AboutDialog:license-type] and [property@AboutDialog:license] are for the application's own information.
See those properties for more details.
This can be useful to attribute the application dependencies or data.
Examples:
```c adw_about_dialog_add_legal_section (ADW_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("Copyright and a known license"), "© 2022 Example", GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_2_1, NULL);
adw_about_dialog_add_legal_section (ADW_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("Copyright and custom license"), "© 2022 Example", GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM, "Custom license text");
adw_about_dialog_add_legal_section (ADW_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("Copyright only"), "© 2022 Example", GTK_LICENSE_UNKNOWN, NULL);
adw_about_dialog_add_legal_section (ADW_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("Custom license only"), NULL, GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM, "Something completely custom here."); ```
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_add_link
function.description:
Adds an extra link to the Details page.
Extra links are displayed under the comment and website.
Underlines in @title will be interpreted as indicating a mnemonic.
See [property@AboutDialog:website].
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_add_other_app
function.description:
Adds another application to @self.
The application will be displayed at the bottom of the main page, in a separate section. Each added application will be presented as a row with @title and @summary, as well as an icon with the name @appid. Clicking the row will show @appid in the software center app.
This can be used to link to your other applications if you have multiple.
Example:
```c adw_about_dialog_add_other_app (ADW_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), "org.gnome.Boxes", _("Boxes"), _("Virtualization made simple")); ```
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_about_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwAboutDialog`.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_new_from_appdata
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwAboutDialog` using AppStream metadata.
This automatically sets the following properties with the following AppStream values:
* [property@AboutDialog:application-icon] is set from the `<id>` * [property@AboutDialog:application-name] is set from the `<name>` * [property@AboutDialog:developer-name] is set from the `<name>` within `<developer>` * [property@AboutDialog:version] is set from the version of the latest release * [property@AboutDialog:website] is set from the `<url type="homepage">` * [property@AboutDialog:support-url] is set from the `<url type="help">` * [property@AboutDialog:issue-url] is set from the `<url type="bugtracker">` * [property@AboutDialog:license-type] is set from the `<project_license>`. If the license type retrieved from AppStream is not listed in [enum@Gtk.License], it will be set to `GTK_LICENCE_CUSTOM`.
If @release_notes_version is not `NULL`, [property@AboutDialog:release-notes-version] is set to match it, while [property@AboutDialog:release-notes] is set from the AppStream release description for that version.
Since: 1.5

parameter.name: release_notes_version
parameter.parameter_description: The version to retrieve release notes for

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_application_icon
function.description:
Sets the name of the application icon for @self.
The icon is displayed at the top of the main page.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_application_name
function.description:
Sets the application name for @self.
The name is displayed at the top of the main page.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_artists
function.description:
Sets the list of artists of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_comments
function.description:
Sets the comments about the application.
Comments will be shown on the Details page, above links.
Unlike [property@Gtk.AboutDialog:comments], this string can be long and detailed. It can also contain links and Pango markup.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_copyright
function.description:
Sets the copyright information for @self.
This should be a short string of one or two lines, for example: `© 2022 Example`.
The copyright information will be displayed on the Legal page, before the application license.
[method@AboutDialog.add_legal_section] can be used to add copyright information for the application dependencies or other components.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_debug_info
function.description:
Sets the debug information for @self.
Debug information will be shown on the Troubleshooting page. It's intended to be attached to issue reports when reporting issues against the application.
`AdwAboutDialog` provides a quick way to save debug information to a file. When saving, [property@AboutDialog:debug-info-filename] would be used as the suggested filename.
Debug information cannot contain markup or links.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_debug_info_filename
function.description:
Sets the debug information filename for @self.
It will be used as the suggested filename when saving debug information to a file.
See [property@AboutDialog:debug-info].
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_designers
function.description:
Sets the list of designers of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_developer_name
function.description:
Sets the developer name for @self.
The developer name is displayed on the main page, under the application name.
If the application is developed by multiple people, the developer name can be set to values like "AppName team", "AppName developers" or "The AppName project", and the individual contributors can be listed on the Credits page, with [property@AboutDialog:developers] and related properties.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_developers
function.description:
Sets the list of developers of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_documenters
function.description:
Sets the list of documenters of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:translator-credits] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_issue_url
function.description:
Sets the issue tracker URL for @self.
The issue tracker link is displayed on the main page.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_license
function.description:
Sets the license for @self.
This can be used to set a custom text for the license if it can't be set via [property@AboutDialog:license-type].
When set, [property@AboutDialog:license-type] will be set to `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM`.
The license text will be displayed on the Legal page, below the copyright information.
License text can contain Pango markup and links.
[method@AboutDialog.add_legal_section] can be used to add license information for the application dependencies or other components.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_license_type
function.description:
Sets the license for @self from a list of known licenses.
If the application's license is not in the list, [property@AboutDialog:license] can be used instead. The license type will be automatically set to `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM` in that case.
If @license_type is `GTK_LICENSE_UNKNOWN`, no information will be displayed.
If @license_type is different from `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM`. [property@AboutDialog:license] will be cleared out.
The license description will be displayed on the Legal page, below the copyright information.
[method@AboutDialog.add_legal_section] can be used to add license information for the application dependencies or other components.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_release_notes
function.description:
Sets the release notes for @self. Release notes are displayed on the the What's New page. Release notes are formatted the same way as [AppStream descriptions](https://freedesktop.org/software/appstream/docs/chap-Metadata.html#tag-description). The supported formatting options are: * Paragraph (`

`) * Ordered list (`

    `), with list items (`
  1. `) * Unordered list (`
      `), with list items (`
    • `) Within paragraphs and list items, emphasis (``) and inline code (``) text styles are supported. The emphasis is rendered in italic, while inline code is shown in a monospaced font. Any text outside paragraphs or list items is ignored. Nested lists are not supported. `AdwAboutDialog` displays the version above the release notes. If set, the [property@AboutDialog:release-notes-version] of the property will be used as the version; otherwise, [property@AboutDialog:version] is used. Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_release_notes_version
function.description:
Sets the version described by the application's release notes.
The release notes version is displayed on the What's New page, above the release notes.
If not set, [property@AboutDialog:version] will be used instead.
For example, an application with the current version 2.0.2 might want to keep the release notes from 2.0.0, and set the release notes version accordingly.
See [property@AboutDialog:release-notes].
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_support_url
function.description:
Sets the URL of the support page for @self.
The support page link is displayed on the main page.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_translator_credits
function.description:
Sets the translator credits string.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
This string should be `"translator-credits"` or `"translator_credits"` and should be marked as translatable.
The string may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details. When there is more than one translator, they must be separated by a newline in the same string.
See also:
* [property@AboutDialog:developers] * [property@AboutDialog:designers] * [property@AboutDialog:artists] * [property@AboutDialog:documenters] * [method@AboutDialog.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutDialog.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_version
function.description:
Sets the version for @self.
The version is displayed on the main page.
If [property@AboutDialog:release-notes-version] is not set, the version will also be displayed above the release notes on the What's New page.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_about_dialog_set_website
function.description:
Sets the application website URL for @self.
Website is displayed on the Details page, below comments, or on the main page if the Details page doesn't have any other content.
Applications can add other links below, see [method@AboutDialog.add_link].
Since: 1.5

Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.

Debug information will be shown on the Troubleshooting page. It's intended to be attached to issue reports when reporting issues against the application.
`AdwAboutWindow` provides a quick way to save debug information to a file. When saving, [property@AboutWindow:debug-info-filename] would be used as the suggested filename.
Debug information cannot contain markup or links.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_debug_info_filename
function.description:
Sets the debug information filename for @self.
It will be used as the suggested filename when saving debug information to a file.
See [property@AboutWindow:debug-info].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_designers
function.description:
Sets the list of designers of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutWindow:developers] * [property@AboutWindow:artists] * [property@AboutWindow:documenters] * [property@AboutWindow:translator-credits] * [method@AboutWindow.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutWindow.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_developer_name
function.description:
Sets the developer name for @self.
The developer name is displayed on the main page, under the application name.
If the application is developed by multiple people, the developer name can be set to values like "AppName team", "AppName developers" or "The AppName project", and the individual contributors can be listed on the Credits page, with [property@AboutWindow:developers] and related properties.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_developers
function.description:
Sets the list of developers of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutWindow:designers] * [property@AboutWindow:artists] * [property@AboutWindow:documenters] * [property@AboutWindow:translator-credits] * [method@AboutWindow.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutWindow.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_documenters
function.description:
Sets the list of documenters of the application.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
Each name may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details.
See also:
* [property@AboutWindow:developers] * [property@AboutWindow:designers] * [property@AboutWindow:artists] * [property@AboutWindow:translator-credits] * [method@AboutWindow.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutWindow.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_issue_url
function.description:
Sets the issue tracker URL for @self.
The issue tracker link is displayed on the main page.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_license
function.description:
Sets the license for @self.
This can be used to set a custom text for the license if it can't be set via [property@AboutWindow:license-type].
When set, [property@AboutWindow:license-type] will be set to `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM`.
The license text will be displayed on the Legal page, below the copyright information.
License text can contain Pango markup and links.
[method@AboutWindow.add_legal_section] can be used to add license information for the application dependencies or other components.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_license_type
function.description:
Sets the license for @self from a list of known licenses.
If the application's license is not in the list, [property@AboutWindow:license] can be used instead. The license type will be automatically set to `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM` in that case.
If @license_type is `GTK_LICENSE_UNKNOWN`, no information will be displayed.
If @license_type is different from `GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM`. [property@AboutWindow:license] will be cleared out.
The license description will be displayed on the Legal page, below the copyright information.
[method@AboutWindow.add_legal_section] can be used to add license information for the application dependencies or other components.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_release_notes
function.description:
Sets the release notes for @self. Release notes are displayed on the the What's New page. Release notes are formatted the same way as [AppStream descriptions](https://freedesktop.org/software/appstream/docs/chap-Metadata.html#tag-description). The supported formatting options are: * Paragraph (`

`) * Ordered list (`

    `), with list items (`
  1. `) * Unordered list (`
      `), with list items (`
    • `) Within paragraphs and list items, emphasis (``) and inline code (``) text styles are supported. The emphasis is rendered in italic, while inline code is shown in a monospaced font. Any text outside paragraphs or list items is ignored. Nested lists are not supported. `AdwAboutWindow` displays the version above the release notes. If set, the [property@AboutWindow:release-notes-version] of the property will be used as the version; otherwise, [property@AboutWindow:version] is used. Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_release_notes_version
function.description:
Sets the version described by the application's release notes.
The release notes version is displayed on the What's New page, above the release notes.
If not set, [property@AboutWindow:version] will be used instead.
For example, an application with the current version 2.0.2 might want to keep the release notes from 2.0.0, and set the release notes version accordingly.
See [property@AboutWindow:release-notes].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_support_url
function.description:
Sets the URL of the support page for @self.
The support page link is displayed on the main page.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_translator_credits
function.description:
Sets the translator credits string.
It will be displayed on the Credits page.
This string should be `"translator-credits"` or `"translator_credits"` and should be marked as translatable.
The string may contain email addresses and URLs, see the introduction for more details. When there is more than one translator, they must be separated by a newline in the same string.
See also:
* [property@AboutWindow:developers] * [property@AboutWindow:designers] * [property@AboutWindow:artists] * [property@AboutWindow:documenters] * [method@AboutWindow.add_credit_section] * [method@AboutWindow.add_acknowledgement_section]
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_version
function.description:
Sets the version for @self.
The version is displayed on the main page.
If [property@AboutWindow:release-notes-version] is not set, the version will also be displayed above the release notes on the What's New page.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_about_window_set_website
function.description:
Sets the application website URL for @self.
Website is displayed on the Details page, below comments, or on the main page if the Details page doesn't have any other content.
Applications can add other links below, see [method@AboutWindow.add_link].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AboutDialog].

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_add_response
function.description:
Adds a response with @id and @label to @self.
Responses are represented as buttons in the dialog.
Response ID must be unique. It will be used in [signal@AlertDialog::response] to tell which response had been activated, as well as to inspect and modify the response later.
An embedded underline in @label indicates a mnemonic.
[method@AlertDialog.set_response_label] can be used to change the response label after it had been added.
[method@AlertDialog.set_response_enabled] and [method@AlertDialog.set_response_appearance] can be used to customize the responses further.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_add_responses
function.description:
Adds multiple responses to @self.
This is the same as calling [method@AlertDialog.add_response] repeatedly. The variable argument list should be `NULL`-terminated list of response IDs and labels.
Example:
```c adw_alert_dialog_add_responses (dialog, "cancel", _("_Cancel"), "discard", _("_Discard"), "save", _("_Save"), NULL); ```
Since: 1.5

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: label for first response, then more id-label pairs

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_choose
function.description:
This function shows @self to the user.
If the window is an [class@Window] or [class@ApplicationWindow], the dialog will be shown within it. Otherwise, it will be a separate window.
Since: 1.5

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a callback to call when the operation is complete

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_choose_finish
function.description:
Finishes the [method@AlertDialog.choose] call and returns the response ID.
Since: 1.5
function.return: the ID of the response that was selected, or [property@AlertDialog:close-response] if the call was cancelled.

Special XML characters in the `printf()` arguments passed to this function will automatically be escaped as necessary, see [func@GLib.markup_printf_escaped].

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_close_response
function.description:
Sets the ID of the close response of @self.
It will be passed to [signal@AlertDialog::response] if the dialog is closed by pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd> or with a system action.
It doesn't have to correspond to any of the responses in the dialog.
The default close response is `close`.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_default_response
function.description:
Sets the ID of the default response of @self.
If set, pressing <kbd>Enter</kbd> will activate the corresponding button.
If set to `NULL` or to a non-existent response ID, pressing <kbd>Enter</kbd> will do nothing.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_extra_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @self.
The child widget is displayed below the heading and body.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_heading
function.description:
Sets the heading of @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_heading_use_markup
function.description:
Sets whether the heading of @self includes Pango markup.
See [func@Pango.parse_markup].
Since: 1.5

parameter.name: use_markup
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use markup for heading

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_prefer_wide_layout
function.description:
Sets whether @self prefers wide layout.
Prefer horizontal button layout when possible, and wider dialog width otherwise.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_response_appearance
function.description: Sets the appearance for @response. Use `ADW_RESPONSE_SUGGESTED` to mark important responses such as the affirmative action, like the Save button in the example. Use `ADW_RESPONSE_DESTRUCTIVE` to draw attention to the potentially damaging consequences of using @response. This appearance acts as a warning to the user. The Discard button in the example is using this appearance. The default appearance is `ADW_RESPONSE_DEFAULT`. Negative responses like Cancel or Close should use the default appearance. Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_response_enabled
function.description:
Sets whether @response is enabled.
If @response is not enabled, the corresponding button will have [property@Gtk.Widget:sensitive] set to `FALSE` and it can't be activated as a default response.
@response can still be used as [property@AlertDialog:close-response] while it's not enabled.
Responses are enabled by default.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_alert_dialog_set_response_label
function.description:
Sets the label of @response to @label.
Labels are displayed on the dialog buttons. An embedded underline in @label indicates a mnemonic.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_animation_get_follow_enable_animations_setting
function.description:
Gets whether @self should be skipped when animations are globally disabled.
Since: 1.3
function.return: whether to follow the global setting

function.name: adw_animation_get_state
function.description:
Gets the current value of @self.
The state indicates whether @self is currently playing, paused, finished or hasn't been started yet.

function.name: adw_animation_get_target
function.description: Gets the target @self animates.

function.name: adw_animation_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of @self.

function.name: adw_animation_get_widget
function.description:
Gets the widget @self was created for.
It provides the frame clock for the animation. It's not strictly necessary for this widget to be same as the one being animated.
The widget must be mapped in order for the animation to work. If it's not mapped, or if it gets unmapped during an ongoing animation, the animation will be automatically skipped.

function.name: adw_animation_pause
function.description:
Pauses a playing animation for @self.
Does nothing if the current state of @self isn't `ADW_ANIMATION_PLAYING`.
Sets [property@Animation:state] to `ADW_ANIMATION_PAUSED`.

function.name: adw_animation_play
function.description:
Starts the animation for @self.
If the animation is playing, paused or has been completed, restarts it from the beginning. This allows to easily play an animation regardless of whether it's already playing or not.
Sets [property@Animation:state] to `ADW_ANIMATION_PLAYING`.
The animation will be automatically skipped if [property@Animation:widget] is unmapped, or if [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-enable-animations] is `FALSE`.
As such, it's not guaranteed that the animation will actually run. For example, when using [func@GLib.idle_add] and starting an animation immediately afterwards, it's entirely possible that the idle callback will run after the animation has already finished, and not while it's playing.

function.name: adw_animation_reset
function.description:
Resets the animation for @self.
Sets [property@Animation:state] to `ADW_ANIMATION_IDLE`.

function.name: adw_animation_resume
function.description:
Resumes a paused animation for @self.
This function must only be used if the animation has been paused with [method@Animation.pause].
Sets [property@Animation:state] to `ADW_ANIMATION_PLAYING`.

function.name: adw_animation_set_follow_enable_animations_setting
function.description:
Sets whether to skip @self when animations are globally disabled.
The default behavior is to skip the animation. Set to `FALSE` to disable this behavior.
This can be useful for cases where animation is essential, like spinners, or in demo applications. Most other animations should keep it enabled.
See [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-enable-animations].
Since: 1.3

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: whether to follow the global setting

function.name: adw_animation_set_target
function.description: Sets the target @self animates to @target.

function.name: adw_animation_skip
function.description:
Skips the animation for @self.
If the animation hasn't been started yet, is playing, or is paused, instantly skips the animation to the end and causes [signal@Animation::done] to be emitted.
Sets [property@Animation:state] to `ADW_ANIMATION_FINISHED`.

function.name: adw_application_get_style_manager

If `application_id` is not `NULL`, then it must be valid. See [func@Gio.Application.id_is_valid].
If no application ID is given then some features (most notably application uniqueness) will be disabled.

Most applications should not use this function.

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwBottomSheet`.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_align
function.description:
Sets horizontal alignment of the bottom sheet.
0 means the bottom sheet is flush with the start edge, 1 means it's flush with the end edge. 0.5 means it's centered.
Only used when [property@BottomSheet:full-width] is set to `FALSE`.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_bottom_bar
function.description:
Sets the bottom bar widget for @self.
Shown when [property@BottomSheet:open] is `FALSE`. When open, morphs into the [property@BottomSheet:sheet].
Bottom bar can be temporarily hidden using the [property@BottomSheet:reveal-bottom-bar] property.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_can_close
function.description:
Sets whether the bottom sheet can be closed by user.
It can be closed via the close button, swiping down, pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd> or clicking the content dimming (when modal).
Bottom sheet can still be closed using [property@BottomSheet:open].
Since: 1.6

parameter.name: can_close
parameter.parameter_description: whether the sheet can be closed by user

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_can_open
function.description:
Sets whether the bottom sheet can be opened by user.
It can be opened via clicking or swiping up from the bottom bar.
Does nothing if [property@BottomSheet:bottom-bar] is not set.
Bottom sheet can still be opened using [property@BottomSheet:open].
Since: 1.6

parameter.name: can_open
parameter.parameter_description: whether the sheet can be opened by user.

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_content
function.description:
Sets the content widget for @self.
It's always shown, and the bottom sheet is overlaid over it.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_full_width
function.description:
Sets whether the bottom sheet takes the full width.
When full width, [property@BottomSheet:align] is ignored.
Since: 1.6

parameter.name: full_width
parameter.parameter_description: whether the sheet takes up the full width

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_modal
function.description:
Sets whether the bottom sheet is modal.
When modal, [property@BottomSheet:content] will be dimmed when the bottom sheet is open, and clicking it will close the bottom sheet. It also cannot be focused with keyboard.
Otherwise, the content is accessible even when the bottom sheet is open.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_open
function.description:
Sets whether the bottom sheet is open.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_reveal_bottom_bar
function.description:
Sets whether to reveal the bottom bar.
The transition will be animated.
See [property@BottomSheet:bottom-bar] and [property@BottomSheet:bottom-bar-height].
Since: 1.7

parameter.name: reveal
parameter.parameter_description: whether to reveal the bottom bar

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_sheet
function.description:
Sets the bottom sheet widget for @self.
Only shown when [property@BottomSheet:open] is `TRUE`.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_bottom_sheet_set_show_drag_handle
function.description:
Sets whether to show a drag handle in the bottom sheet.
The handle will be overlaid over [property@BottomSheet:sheet].
When the handle is shown, [class@HeaderBar] will hide its default title, and [class@ToolbarView] will reserve space if there are no top bars.
Showing drag handle also allows to swipe the bottom sheet down (and to swipe the bottom bar up) with a pointer, instead of just touchscreen.
Since: 1.6

parameter.name: show_drag_handle
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the drag handle

function.description:

function.name: adw_breakpoint_condition_parse
function.description:
Parses a condition from a string.
Length conditions are specified as `<type>: <value>[<unit>]`, where:
- `<type>` can be `min-width`, `max-width`, `min-height` or `max-height` - `<value>` is a fractional number - `<unit>` can be `px`, `pt` or `sp`
If the unit is omitted, `px` is assumed.
See [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_length].
Examples:
- `min-width: 500px` - `min-height: 400pt` - `max-width: 100sp` - `max-height: 500`
Ratio conditions are specified as `<type>: <width>[/<height>]`, where:
- `<type>` can be `min-aspect-ratio` or `max-aspect-ratio` - `<width>` and `<height>` are integer numbers
See [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_ratio].
The ratio is represented as `<width>` divided by `<height>`.
If `<height>` is omitted, it's assumed to be 1.
Examples:
- `min-aspect-ratio: 4/3` - `max-aspect-ratio: 1`
The logical operators `and`, `or` can be used to compose a complex condition as follows:
- `<condition> and <condition>`: the condition is true when both `<condition>`s are true, same as when using [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_and] - `<condition> or <condition>`: the condition is true when either of the `<condition>`s is true, same as when using [ctor@BreakpointCondition.new_or]
Examples:
- `min-width: 400px and max-aspect-ratio: 4/3` - `max-width: 360sp or max-width: 360px`
Conditions can be further nested using parentheses, for example:
- `min-width: 400px and (max-aspect-ratio: 4/3 or max-height: 400px)`
If parentheses are omitted, the first operator takes priority.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_breakpoint_condition_to_string
function.description:
Returns a textual representation of @self.
The returned string can be parsed by [func@BreakpointCondition.parse].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_clamp_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new `AdwClampLayout`.

function.name: adw_clamp_layout_set_maximum_size
function.description:
Sets the maximum size allocated to the children.
It is the width if the layout is horizontal, or the height if it is vertical.

function.name: adw_clamp_layout_set_tightening_threshold
function.description:
Sets the size above which the children are clamped.
Starting from this size, the layout will tighten its grip on the children, slowly allocating less and less of the available size up to the maximum allocated size. Below that threshold and below the maximum size, the children will be allocated all the available size.
If the threshold is greater than the maximum size to allocate to the children, they will be allocated the whole size up to the maximum. If the threshold is lower than the minimum size to allocate to the children, that size will be used as the tightening threshold.
Effectively, tightening the grip on a child before it reaches its maximum size makes transitions to and from the maximum size smoother when resizing.

function.name: adw_clamp_layout_set_unit
function.description:
Sets the length unit for maximum size and tightening threshold.
Allows the sizes to vary depending on the text scale factor.
Since: 1.4

If the threshold is greater than the maximum size to allocate to the child, the child will be allocated all the width up to the maximum. If the threshold is lower than the minimum size to allocate to the child, that size will be used as the tightening threshold.

function.description:
Sets the factory for populating list items.
This factory is always used for the item in the row. It is also used for items in the popup unless [property@ComboRow:list-factory] is set.

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_header_factory
function.description:
Sets the factory to use for creating header widgets for the popup.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_list_factory
function.description:
Sets the factory for populating list items in the popup.
If this is not set, [property@ComboRow:factory] is used.

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_model
function.description: Sets the model that provides the displayed items.

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_search_match_mode
function.description:
Sets the match mode for the search filter.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_selected
function.description: Selects the item at the given position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to select, or [const@Gtk.INVALID_LIST_POSITION]

function.name: adw_combo_row_set_use_subtitle
function.description:
Sets whether to use the current value as the subtitle.
If you use a custom list item factory, you will need to give the row a name conversion expression with [property@ComboRow:expression].
If set to `TRUE`, you should not access [property@ActionRow:subtitle].
The subtitle is interpreted as Pango markup if [property@PreferencesRow:use-markup] is set to `TRUE`.

parameter.name: use_subtitle
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use the current value as the subtitle

function.name: adw_dialog_add_breakpoint
function.description:
Adds @breakpoint to @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_close
function.description:
Attempts to close @self.
If the [property@Dialog:can-close] property is set to `FALSE`, the [signal@Dialog::close-attempt] signal is emitted.
See also: [method@Dialog.force_close].
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_force_close
function.description:
Closes @self.
Unlike [method@Dialog.close], it succeeds even if [property@Dialog:can-close] is set to `FALSE`.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_can_close
function.description:
Gets whether @self can be closed.
Since: 1.5
function.return: whether the dialog can be closed

function.name: adw_dialog_get_child
function.description:
Gets the child widget of @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_content_height
function.description:
Gets the height of the dialog's contents.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_content_width
function.description:
Gets the width of the dialog's contents.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_current_breakpoint
function.description:
Gets the current breakpoint.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_default_widget
function.description:
Gets the default widget for @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_focus
function.description:
Gets the focus widget for @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_follows_content_size
function.description:
Gets whether to size content of @self automatically.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_presentation_mode
function.description:
Gets presentation mode for @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_get_title
function.description:
Gets the title of @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwDialog`.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_present
function.description:
Presents @self within @parent's window.
If @self is already shown, raises it to the top instead.
If the window is an [class@Window] or [class@ApplicationWindow], the dialog will be shown within it. Otherwise, it will be a separate window.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_can_close
function.description:
Sets whether @self can be closed.
If set to `FALSE`, the close button, shortcuts and [method@Dialog.close] will result in [signal@Dialog::close-attempt] being emitted instead, and bottom sheet close swipe will be disabled. [method@Dialog.force_close] still works.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_content_height
function.description:
Sets the height of the dialog's contents.
Set it to -1 to reset it to the content's natural height.
See also: [property@Gtk.Window:default-height]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_content_width
function.description:
Sets the width of the dialog's contents.
Set it to -1 to reset it to the content's natural width.
See also: [property@Gtk.Window:default-width]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_default_widget
function.description:
Sets the default widget for @self.
It's activated when the user presses Enter.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_focus
function.description:
Sets the focus widget for @self.
If @focus is not the current focus widget, and is focusable, sets it as the focus widget for the dialog.
If focus is `NULL`, unsets the focus widget for this dialog. To set the focus to a particular widget in the dialog, it is usually more convenient to use [method@Gtk.Widget.grab_focus] instead of this function.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_follows_content_size
function.description:
Sets whether to size content of @self automatically.
If set to `TRUE`, always use the content's natural size instead of [property@Dialog:content-width] and [property@Dialog:content-height]. If the content resizes, the dialog will immediately resize as well.
See also: [property@Gtk.Window:resizable]
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_presentation_mode
function.description:
Sets presentation mode for @self.
When set to `ADW_DIALOG_AUTO`, the dialog appears as a bottom sheet when the following condition is met: `max-width: 450px or max-height: 360px`, and as a floating window otherwise.
Set it to `ADW_DIALOG_FLOATING` or `ADW_DIALOG_BOTTOM_SHEET` to always present it a floating window or a bottom sheet respectively, regardless of available size.
Presentation mode does nothing for dialogs presented as a window.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_dialog_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title of @self.
Since: 1.5

function.name: adw_easing_ease
function.description:
Computes easing with @easing for @value.
@value should generally be in the [0, 1] range.

Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_get_show_apply_button

Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_get_text_length
function.description:
Retrieves the current length of the text in @self.
Since: 1.5
function.return: The current number of characters in @self, or 0 if there are none.

function.name: adw_entry_row_grab_focus_without_selecting
function.description:
Causes @self to have keyboard focus without selecting the text.
See [method@Gtk.Text.grab_focus_without_selecting] for more information.
Since: 1.3
function.return: whether the focus is now inside @self

function.name: adw_entry_row_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwEntryRow`.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_remove
function.description:
Removes a child from @self.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_activates_default
function.description:
Sets whether activating the embedded entry can activate the default widget.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: activates
parameter.parameter_description: whether to activate the default widget

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets Pango attributes to apply to the text of the embedded entry.
The [struct@Pango.Attribute]'s `start_index` and `end_index` must refer to the [class@Gtk.EntryBuffer] text, i.e. without the preedit string.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_enable_emoji_completion
function.description:
Sets whether to suggest emoji replacements on @self.
Emoji replacement is done with :-delimited names, like `:heart:`.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: enable_emoji_completion
parameter.parameter_description: Whether emoji completion should be enabled or not

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_input_hints
function.description:
Set additional input hints for @self.
Input hints allow input methods to fine-tune their behavior.
See also: [property@AdwEntryRow:input-purpose]
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_input_purpose
function.description:
Sets the input purpose of @self.
The input purpose can be used by input methods to adjust their behavior.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum length of the entry.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_entry_row_set_show_apply_button
function.description:
Sets whether @self can show the apply button.
When set to `TRUE`, typing text in the entry will reveal an apply button. Clicking it or pressing the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key will hide the button and emit the [signal@EntryRow::apply] signal.
This is useful if changing the entry contents can trigger an expensive operation, e.g. network activity, to avoid triggering it after typing every character.
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: show_apply_button
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the apply button

Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)
