Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)
function.return: `TRUE` if @self can be opened with a swipe gesture

function.name: adw_flap_get_transition_type
function.description:
Gets the type of animation used for reveal and fold transitions in @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwFlap`.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_content
function.description:
Sets the content widget for @self.
It's always displayed when unfolded, and partially visible when folded.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_flap
function.description:
Sets the flap widget for @self.
It's only visible when [property@Flap:reveal-progress] is greater than 0.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_flap_position
function.description:
Sets the flap position for @self.
If it's set to `GTK_PACK_START`, the flap is displayed before the content, if `GTK_PACK_END`, it's displayed after the content.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_fold_duration
function.description:
Sets the fold transition animation duration for @self, in milliseconds.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_fold_policy
function.description:
Sets the fold policy for @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_fold_threshold_policy
function.description:
Sets the fold threshold policy for @self.
If set to `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_MINIMUM`, flap will only fold when the children cannot fit anymore. With `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_NATURAL`, it will fold as soon as children don't get their natural size.
This can be useful if you have a long ellipsizing label and want to let it ellipsize instead of immediately folding.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_locked
function.description:
Sets whether @self is locked.
If `FALSE`, folding when the flap is revealed automatically closes it, and unfolding it when the flap is not revealed opens it. If `TRUE`, [property@Flap:reveal-flap] value never changes on its own.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_modal
function.description:
Sets whether @self is modal.
If `TRUE`, clicking the content widget while flap is revealed, as well as pressing the <kbd>Esc</kbd> key, will close the flap. If `FALSE`, clicks are passed through to the content widget.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_reveal_flap
function.description:
Sets whether the flap widget is revealed for @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

parameter.name: reveal_flap
parameter.parameter_description: whether to reveal the flap widget

function.name: adw_flap_set_reveal_params
function.description:
Sets the reveal animation spring parameters for @self.
The default value is equivalent to:
```c adw_spring_params_new (1, 0.5, 500) ```
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_separator
function.description:
Sets the separator widget for @self.
It's displayed between content and flap when there's no shadow to display. When exactly it's visible depends on the [property@Flap:transition-type] value.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_flap_set_swipe_to_close
function.description:
Sets whether @self can be closed with a swipe gesture.
The area that can be swiped depends on the [property@Flap:transition-type] value.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

parameter.name: swipe_to_close
parameter.parameter_description: whether @self can be closed with a swipe gesture

function.name: adw_flap_set_swipe_to_open
function.description:
Sets whether @self can be opened with a swipe gesture.
The area that can be swiped depends on the [property@Flap:transition-type] value.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

parameter.name: swipe_to_open
parameter.parameter_description: whether @self can be opened with a swipe gesture

function.name: adw_flap_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation used for reveal and fold transitions in @self.
[property@Flap:flap] is transparent by default, which means the content will be seen through it with `ADW_FLAP_TRANSITION_TYPE_OVER` transitions; add the [`.background`](style-classes.html#background) style class to it if this is unwanted.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwflap)

function.name: adw_get_enable_animations
function.description:
Checks whether animations are enabled for @widget.
This should be used when implementing an animated widget to know whether to animate it or not.

function.name: adw_get_major_version
function.description:
Returns the major version number of the Adwaita library.
For example, in libadwaita version 1.2.3 this is 1.
This function is in the library, so it represents the libadwaita library your code is running against. Contrast with the [const@MAJOR_VERSION] constant, which represents the major version of the libadwaita headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the major version number of the Adwaita library

function.name: adw_get_micro_version
function.description:
Returns the micro version number of the Adwaita library.
For example, in libadwaita version 1.2.3 this is 3.
This function is in the library, so it represents the libadwaita library your code is running against. Contrast with the [const@MAJOR_VERSION] constant, which represents the micro version of the libadwaita headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the micro version number of the Adwaita library

function.name: adw_get_minor_version
function.description:
Returns the minor version number of the Adwaita library.
For example, in libadwaita version 1.2.3 this is 2.
This function is in the library, so it represents the libadwaita library your code is running against. Contrast with the [const@MAJOR_VERSION] constant, which represents the minor version of the libadwaita headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the minor version number of the Adwaita library

parameter.parameter_description: the widget to be added to @self

function.name: adw_header_bar_pack_start
function.description: Adds @child to @self, packed with reference to the start of the @self.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to be added to @self

function.name: adw_header_bar_remove
function.description:
Removes a child from @self.
The child must have been added with [method@HeaderBar.pack_start], [method@HeaderBar.pack_end] or [property@HeaderBar:title-widget].

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_centering_policy
function.description: Sets the policy for aligning the center widget.

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_decoration_layout
function.description:
Sets the decoration layout for @self.
If this property is not set, the [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-decoration-layout] setting is used.
The format of the string is button names, separated by commas. A colon separates the buttons that should appear at the start from those at the end. Recognized button names are minimize, maximize, close and icon (the window icon).
For example, “icon:minimize,maximize,close” specifies an icon at the start, and minimize, maximize and close buttons at the end.

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_show_back_button
function.description:
Sets whether @self can show the back button.
The back button will never be shown unless the header bar is placed inside an [class@NavigationView]. Usually, there is no reason to set it to `FALSE`.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: show_back_button
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the back button

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_show_end_title_buttons
function.description:
Sets whether to show title buttons at the end of @self.
See [property@HeaderBar:show-start-title-buttons] for the other side.
Which buttons are actually shown and where is determined by the [property@HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property, and by the state of the window (e.g. a close button will not be shown if the window can't be closed).

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_show_start_title_buttons
function.description:
Sets whether to show title buttons at the start of @self.
See [property@HeaderBar:show-end-title-buttons] for the other side.
Which buttons are actually shown and where is determined by the [property@HeaderBar:decoration-layout] property, and by the state of the window (e.g. a close button will not be shown if the window can't be closed).

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_show_title
function.description:
Sets whether the title widget should be shown.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: show_title
parameter.parameter_description: whether the title widget is visible

function.name: adw_header_bar_set_title_widget
function.description:
Sets the title widget for @self.
When set to `NULL`, the header bar will display the title of the window it is contained in.
To use a different title, use [class@WindowTitle]:
```xml <object class="AdwHeaderBar"> <property name="title-widget"> <object class="AdwWindowTitle"> <property name="title" translatable="yes">Title</property> </object> </property> </object> ```

parameter.name: title_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to use for a title

function.name: adw_init
function.description:
Initializes Libadwaita.
This function can be used instead of [func@Gtk.init] as it initializes GTK implicitly.
There's no need to call this function if you're using [class@Application].
If Libadwaita has already been initialized, the function will simply return.
This makes sure translations, types, themes, and icons for the Adwaita library are set up properly.

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_can_navigate_back
function.description:
Sets whether gestures and shortcuts for navigating backward are enabled.
The supported gestures are:
- One-finger swipe on touchscreens - Horizontal scrolling on touchpads (usually two-finger swipe) - Back/forward mouse buttons
The keyboard back/forward keys are also supported, as well as the <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd> shortcut for horizontal orientation, or <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd> for vertical orientation.
If the orientation is horizontal, for right-to-left locales, gestures and shortcuts are reversed.
Only children that have [property@LeafletPage:navigatable] set to `TRUE` can be navigated to.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_can_navigate_forward
function.description:
Sets whether gestures and shortcuts for navigating forward are enabled.
The supported gestures are:
- One-finger swipe on touchscreens - Horizontal scrolling on touchpads (usually two-finger swipe) - Back/forward mouse buttons
The keyboard back/forward keys are also supported, as well as the <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd> shortcut for horizontal orientation, or <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>↓</kbd> for vertical orientation.
If the orientation is horizontal, for right-to-left locales, gestures and shortcuts are reversed.
Only children that have [property@LeafletPage:navigatable] set to `TRUE` can be navigated to.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_can_unfold
function.description:
Sets whether @self can unfold.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_child_transition_params
function.description:
Sets the child transition spring parameters for @self.
The default value is equivalent to:
```c adw_spring_params_new (1, 0.5, 500) ```
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_fold_threshold_policy
function.description:
Sets the fold threshold policy for @self.
If set to `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_MINIMUM`, it will only fold when the children cannot fit anymore. With `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_NATURAL`, it will fold as soon as children don't get their natural size.
This can be useful if you have a long ellipsizing label and want to let it ellipsize instead of immediately folding.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_homogeneous
function.description:
Sets @self to be homogeneous or not.
If set to `FALSE`, different children can have different size along the opposite orientation.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_mode_transition_duration
function.description:
Sets the mode transition animation duration for @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation used for transitions between modes and children.
The transition type can be changed without problems at runtime, so it is possible to change the animation based on the mode or child that is about to become current.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_visible_child
function.description:
Sets the widget currently visible when the leaflet is folded.
The transition is determined by [property@Leaflet:transition-type] and [property@Leaflet:child-transition-params]. The transition can be cancelled by the user, in which case visible child will change back to the previously visible child.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_leaflet_set_visible_child_name
function.description:
Makes the child with the name @name visible.
See [property@Leaflet:visible-child].
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwleaflet)

function.name: adw_message_dialog_add_response
function.description:
Adds a response with @id and @label to @self.
Responses are represented as buttons in the dialog.
Response ID must be unique. It will be used in [signal@MessageDialog::response] to tell which response had been activated, as well as to inspect and modify the response later.
An embedded underline in @label indicates a mnemonic.
[method@MessageDialog.set_response_label] can be used to change the response label after it had been added.
[method@MessageDialog.set_response_enabled] and [method@MessageDialog.set_response_appearance] can be used to customize the responses further.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

function.name: adw_message_dialog_add_responses
function.description:
Adds multiple responses to @self.
This is the same as calling [method@MessageDialog.add_response] repeatedly. The variable argument list should be `NULL`-terminated list of response IDs and labels.
Example:
```c adw_message_dialog_add_responses (dialog, "cancel", _("_Cancel"), "discard", _("_Discard"), "save", _("_Save"), NULL); ```
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: label for first response, then more id-label pairs

function.description:
Sets the ID of the close response of @self.
It will be passed to [signal@MessageDialog::response] if the window is closed by pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd> or with a system action.
It doesn't have to correspond to any of the responses in the dialog.
The default close response is `close`.

If set to `NULL` or to a non-existent response ID, pressing <kbd>Enter</kbd> will do nothing.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

function.description:

See [func@Pango.parse_markup].
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

parameter.name: use_markup
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use markup for heading

function.name: adw_message_dialog_set_response_appearance
function.description: Sets the appearance for @response. Use `ADW_RESPONSE_SUGGESTED` to mark important responses such as the affirmative action, like the Save button in the example. Use `ADW_RESPONSE_DESTRUCTIVE` to draw attention to the potentially damaging consequences of using @response. This appearance acts as a warning to the user. The Discard button in the example is using this appearance. The default appearance is `ADW_RESPONSE_DEFAULT`. Negative responses like Cancel or Close should use the default appearance. Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

function.name: adw_message_dialog_set_response_enabled
function.description:
Sets whether @response is enabled.
If @response is not enabled, the corresponding button will have [property@Gtk.Widget:sensitive] set to `FALSE` and it can't be activated as a default response.
@response can still be used as [property@MessageDialog:close-response] while it's not enabled.
Responses are enabled by default.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

function.name: adw_message_dialog_set_response_label
function.description:
Sets the label of @response to @label.
Labels are displayed on the dialog buttons. An embedded underline in @label indicates a mnemonic.
Since: 1.2 Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@AlertDialog].

function.name: adw_navigation_page_set_can_pop
function.description:
Sets whether @self can be popped from navigation stack.
Set it to `FALSE` to disable shortcuts and gestures, as well as remove the back button from [class@HeaderBar].
Manually calling [method@NavigationView.pop] or using the `navigation.pop` action will still work.
See [property@HeaderBar:show-back-button] for removing only the back button, but not shortcuts.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: can_pop
parameter.parameter_description: whether the page can be popped from navigation stack

function.name: adw_navigation_page_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget of @self.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_page_set_tag
function.description:
Sets the tag for @self.
The tag can be used to retrieve the page with [method@NavigationView.find_page], as well as with [method@NavigationView.push_by_tag], [method@NavigationView.pop_to_tag] or [method@NavigationView.replace_with_tags].
Tags must be unique within each [class@NavigationView].
The tag also must be set to use the `navigation.push` action.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_page_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title of @self.
It's displayed in [class@HeaderBar] instead of the window title, and used as the tooltip on the next page's back button, as well as by screen reader.
Since: 1.4

function.description:
Creates a new `AdwNavigationSplitView`.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_collapsed
function.description:
Sets whether @self is collapsed.
When collapsed, the children are put inside an [class@NavigationView], otherwise they are displayed side by side.
The [property@NavigationSplitView:show-content] controls which child is visible while collapsed.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_content
function.description:
Sets the content widget for @self.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_max_sidebar_width
function.description:
Sets the maximum sidebar width for @self.
Maximum width is affected by [property@NavigationSplitView:sidebar-width-unit].
The sidebar widget can still be allocated with larger width if its own minimum width exceeds it.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_min_sidebar_width
function.description:
Sets the minimum sidebar width for @self.
Minimum width is affected by [property@NavigationSplitView:sidebar-width-unit].
The sidebar widget can still be allocated with larger width if its own minimum width exceeds it.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_show_content
function.description:
Sets which page is visible when @self is collapsed.
If set to `TRUE`, the content widget will be the visible page when [property@NavigationSplitView:collapsed] is `TRUE`; otherwise the sidebar widget will be visible.
If the split view is already collapsed, the visible page changes immediately.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: show_content
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show content when collapsed

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_sidebar
function.description:
Sets the sidebar widget for @self.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_sidebar_position
function.description:
Sets the sidebar position for @self.
If set to `GTK_PACK_START`, the sidebar is displayed before the content, and the sidebar will be the root page when collapsed.
If set to `GTK_PACK_END`, the sidebar is displayed after the content, and the content will be the root page.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_sidebar_width_fraction
function.description:
Sets the preferred sidebar width as a fraction of the total width of @self.
The preferred width is additionally limited by [property@NavigationSplitView:min-sidebar-width] and [property@NavigationSplitView:max-sidebar-width].
The sidebar widget can be allocated with larger width if its own minimum width exceeds the preferred width.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_split_view_set_sidebar_width_unit
function.description:
Sets the length unit for minimum and maximum sidebar widths.
See [property@NavigationSplitView:min-sidebar-width] and [property@NavigationSplitView:max-sidebar-width].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_add
function.description:
Permanently adds @page to @self.
Any page that has been added will stay in @self even after being popped from the navigation stack.
Adding a page while no page is visible will automatically push it to the navigation stack.
See [method@NavigationView.remove].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_find_page
function.description:
Finds a page in @self by its tag.
See [property@NavigationPage:tag].
Since: 1.4
function.return: the page with the given tag

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_animate_transitions
function.description:
Gets whether @self animates page transitions.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_hhomogeneous
function.description:
Gets whether @self is horizontally homogeneous.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_navigation_stack
function.description:
Returns a [iface@Gio.ListModel] that contains the pages in navigation stack.
The pages are sorted from root page to visible page.
This can be used to keep an up-to-date view.
Since: 1.4
function.return: a list model for the navigation stack

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_pop_on_escape
function.description:
Gets whether pressing Escape pops the current page on @self.
Since: 1.4
function.return: whether to pop the current page

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_previous_page
function.description:
Gets the previous page for @page.
If @page is in the navigation stack, returns the page popping @page will reveal.
If @page is the root page or is not in the navigation stack, returns `NULL`.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_vhomogeneous
function.description:
Gets whether @self is vertically homogeneous.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_visible_page
function.description:
Gets the currently visible page in @self.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_get_visible_page_tag
function.description:
Gets the tag of the currently visible page in @self.
Since: 1.7
function.return: the tag of the currently visible page

function.name: adw_navigation_view_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwNavigationView`.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_pop
function.description:
Pops the visible page from the navigation stack.
Does nothing if the navigation stack contains less than two pages.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called, the page is automatically removed.
[signal@NavigationView::popped] will be emitted for the current visible page.
See [method@NavigationView.pop_to_page] and [method@NavigationView.pop_to_tag].
Since: 1.4
function.return: `TRUE` if a page has been popped

function.name: adw_navigation_view_pop_to_page
function.description:
Pops pages from the navigation stack until @page is visible.
@page must be in the navigation stack.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called for any of the popped pages, they are automatically removed.
[signal@NavigationView::popped] will be be emitted for each of the popped pages.
See [method@NavigationView.pop] and [method@NavigationView.pop_to_tag].
Since: 1.4
function.return: `TRUE` if any pages have been popped

function.name: adw_navigation_view_pop_to_tag
function.description:
Pops pages from the navigation stack until page with the tag @tag is visible.
The page must be in the navigation stack.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called for any of the popped pages, they are automatically removed.
[signal@NavigationView::popped] will be emitted for each of the popped pages.
See [method@NavigationView.pop_to_page] and [property@NavigationPage:tag].
Since: 1.4
function.return: `TRUE` if any pages have been popped

function.name: adw_navigation_view_push
function.description:
Pushes @page onto the navigation stack.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called, the page is automatically removed once it's popped.
[signal@NavigationView::pushed] will be emitted for @page.
See [method@NavigationView.push_by_tag].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_push_by_tag
function.description:
Pushes the page with the tag @tag onto the navigation stack.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called, the page is automatically removed once it's popped.
[signal@NavigationView::pushed] will be emitted for the page.
See [method@NavigationView.push] and [property@NavigationPage:tag].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_remove
function.description:
Removes @page from @self.
If @page is currently in the navigation stack, it will be removed once it's popped. Otherwise, it's removed immediately.
See [method@NavigationView.add].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_replace
function.description:
Replaces the current navigation stack with @pages.
The last page becomes the visible page.
Replacing the navigation stack has no animation.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called for any pages that are no longer in the navigation stack, they are automatically removed.
@n_pages can be 0, in that case no page will be visible after calling this method. This can be useful for removing all pages from @self.
The [signal@NavigationView::replaced] signal will be emitted.
See [method@NavigationView.replace_with_tags].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_replace_with_tags
function.description:
Replaces the current navigation stack with pages with the tags @tags.
The last page becomes the visible page.
Replacing the navigation stack has no animation.
If [method@NavigationView.add] hasn't been called for any pages that are no longer in the navigation stack, they are automatically removed.
@n_tags can be 0, in that case no page will be visible after calling this method. This can be useful for removing all pages from @self.
The [signal@NavigationView::replaced] signal will be emitted.
See [method@NavigationView.replace] and [property@NavigationPage:tag].
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: tags
parameter.parameter_description: tags of the pages in the navigation stack

function.name: adw_navigation_view_set_animate_transitions
function.description:
Sets whether @self should animate page transitions.
Gesture-based transitions are always animated.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_navigation_view_set_hhomogeneous
function.description:
Sets @self to be horizontally homogeneous or not.
If the view is horizontally homogeneous, it allocates the same width for all pages.
If it's not, the view may change width when a different page becomes visible.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_navigation_view_set_pop_on_escape
function.description:
Sets whether pressing Escape pops the current page on @self.
Applications using `AdwNavigationView` to implement a browser may want to disable it.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: pop_on_escape
parameter.parameter_description: whether to pop the current page when pressing Escape

function.name: adw_navigation_view_set_vhomogeneous
function.description:
Sets @self to be vertically homogeneous or not.
If the view is vertically homogeneous, it allocates the same height for all pages.
If it's not, the view may change height when a different page becomes visible.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_preferences_window_push_subpage
function.description:

function.name: adw_preferences_window_remove
function.description:
Removes a page from @self.
Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@PreferencesDialog].

function.name: adw_preferences_window_set_can_navigate_back
function.description:
Sets whether gestures and shortcuts for closing subpages are enabled.
The supported gestures are:
- One-finger swipe on touchscreens - Horizontal scrolling on touchpads (usually two-finger swipe) - Back mouse button
The keyboard back key is also supported, as well as the <kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd> shortcut.
For right-to-left locales, gestures and shortcuts are reversed.
Has no effect for subpages added with [method@PreferencesWindow.push_subpage].
Deprecated: 1.4: Use [method@NavigationPage.set_can_pop] instead.

function.name: adw_preferences_window_set_search_enabled
function.description:
Sets whether search is enabled for @self.
Deprecated: 1.6: Use [class@PreferencesDialog].

Makes @page the visible page of @self.

function.name: adw_spin_row_new_with_range
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwSpinRow` with the given properties.
This is a convenience constructor that allows creation of a numeric `AdwSpinRow` without manually creating an adjustment. The value is initially set to the minimum value and a page increment of 10 * @step is the default. The precision of the spin row is equivalent to the precisions of @step.
::: note The way in which the precision is derived works best if @step is a power of ten. If the resulting precision is not suitable for your needs, use [method@SpinRow.set_digits] to correct it.
Since: 1.4

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: increment added or subtracted by spinning the widget

function.description:
Sets whether the button can be smaller than the natural size of its contents.
If set to `TRUE`, the label will ellipsize.
See [method@Gtk.Button.set_can_shrink] and [method@Gtk.MenuButton.set_can_shrink].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_split_button_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child widget.
Setting the child widget will set [property@SplitButton:label] and [property@SplitButton:icon-name] to `NULL`.

function.name: adw_split_button_set_direction
function.description:
Sets the direction in which the popup will be popped up.
The dropdown arrow icon will point at the same direction.
If the does not fit in the available space in the given direction, GTK will try its best to keep it inside the screen and fully visible.
If you pass `GTK_ARROW_NONE`, it's equivalent to `GTK_ARROW_DOWN`.

function.name: adw_split_button_set_dropdown_tooltip
function.description:
Sets the tooltip of the dropdown button of @self.
The tooltip can be marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_split_button_set_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the name of the icon used to automatically populate the button.
Setting the icon name will set [property@SplitButton:label] and [property@SplitButton:child] to `NULL`.

function.name: adw_split_button_set_label
function.description:
Sets the label for @self.
Setting the label will set [property@SplitButton:icon-name] and [property@SplitButton:child] to `NULL`.

function.name: adw_split_button_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets the menu model from which the popup will be created.
If the menu model is `NULL`, the dropdown is disabled.
A [class@Gtk.Popover] will be created from the menu model with [ctor@Gtk.PopoverMenu.new_from_model]. Actions will be connected as documented for this function.
If [property@SplitButton:popover] is already set, it will be dissociated from the button, and the property is set to `NULL`.

function.name: adw_split_button_set_popover
function.description:
Sets the popover that will be popped up when the dropdown is clicked.
If the popover is `NULL`, the dropdown is disabled.
If [property@SplitButton:menu-model] is set, the menu model is dissociated from the button, and the property is set to `NULL`.

function.description:
Sets whether an underline in the text indicates a mnemonic.
See [property@SplitButton:label].

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: whether an underline in the text indicates a mnemonic

The time starts at 0 and ends at [property@SpringAnimation:estimated_duration].
See also [method@SpringAnimation.calculate_velocity].
Since: 1.3

function.description:

The time starts at 0 and ends at [property@SpringAnimation:estimated_duration].
See also [method@SpringAnimation.calculate_value].
Since: 1.3

function.description: Gets whether @self should be clamped.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_epsilon
function.description: Gets the precision of the spring.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_estimated_duration
function.description:
Gets the estimated duration of @self, in milliseconds.
Can be [const@DURATION_INFINITE] if the spring damping is set to 0.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_initial_velocity
function.description: Gets the initial velocity of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_spring_params
function.description: Gets the physical parameters of the spring of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_value_from
function.description: Gets the value @self will animate from.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_value_to
function.description: Gets the value @self will animate to.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_get_velocity
function.description: Gets the current velocity of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwSpringAnimation` on @widget.
The animation will animate @target from @from to @to with the dynamics of a spring described by @spring_params.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to create animation on

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_clamp
function.description:
Sets whether @self should be clamped.
If set to `TRUE`, the animation will abruptly end as soon as it reaches the final value, preventing overshooting.
It won't prevent overshooting [property@SpringAnimation:value-from] if a relative negative [property@SpringAnimation:initial-velocity] is set.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_epsilon
function.description:
Sets the precision of the spring.
The level of precision used to determine when the animation has come to a rest, that is, when the amplitude of the oscillations becomes smaller than this value.
If the epsilon value is too small, the animation will take a long time to stop after the animated value has stopped visibly changing.
If the epsilon value is too large, the animation will end prematurely.
The default value is 0.001.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_initial_velocity
function.description:
Sets the initial velocity of @self.
Initial velocity affects only the animation curve, but not its duration.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_spring_params
function.description: Sets the physical parameters of the spring of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_value_from
function.description:
Sets the value @self will animate from.
The animation will start at this value and end at [property@SpringAnimation:value-to].

function.name: adw_spring_animation_set_value_to
function.description:
Sets the value @self will animate to.
The animation will start at [property@SpringAnimation:value-from] and end at this value.

function.name: adw_spring_params_get_damping
function.description: Gets the damping of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_params_get_damping_ratio
function.description: Gets the damping ratio of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_params_get_mass
function.description: Gets the mass of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_params_get_stiffness
function.description: Gets the stiffness of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_params_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwSpringParams` from @mass, @stiffness and @damping_ratio.
The damping value is calculated from @damping_ratio and the other two parameters.
* If @damping_ratio is 0, the spring will not be damped and will oscillate endlessly. * If @damping_ratio is between 0 and 1, the spring is underdamped and will always overshoot. * If @damping_ratio is 1, the spring is critically damped and will reach its resting position the quickest way possible. * If @damping_ratio is larger than 1, the spring is overdamped and will reach its resting position faster than it can complete an oscillation.
[ctor@SpringParams.new_full] allows to pass a raw damping value instead.

parameter.name: damping_ratio
parameter.parameter_description: the damping ratio of the spring

function.name: adw_spring_params_new_full
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwSpringParams` from @mass, @stiffness and @damping.
See [ctor@SpringParams.new] for a simplified constructor using damping ratio instead of @damping.

function.name: adw_spring_params_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of @self.

function.name: adw_spring_params_unref
function.description:
Decreases the reference count of @self.
If the last reference is dropped, the structure is freed.

function.description:

Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_get_transition_running
function.description:
Gets whether a transition is currently running for @self.
If a transition is impossible, the property value will be set to `TRUE` and then immediately to `FALSE`, so it's possible to rely on its notifications to know that a transition has happened.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)
function.return: whether a transition is currently running

function.name: adw_squeezer_get_transition_type
function.description:
Gets the type of animation used for transitions between children in @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_get_visible_child
function.description:
Gets the currently visible child of @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_get_xalign
function.description:
Gets the horizontal alignment, from 0 (start) to 1 (end).
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_get_yalign
function.description:
Gets the vertical alignment, from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwSqueezer`.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_page_get_child
function.description:
Returns the squeezer child to which @self belongs.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_page_get_enabled
function.description:
Gets whether @self is enabled.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_page_set_enabled
function.description:
Sets whether @self is enabled.
If a child is disabled, it will be ignored when looking for the child fitting the available size best.
This allows to programmatically and prematurely hide a child even if it fits in the available space.
This can be used e.g. to ensure a certain child is hidden below a certain window width, or any other constraint you find suitable.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_remove
function.description:
Removes a child widget from @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_allow_none
function.description:
Sets whether to allow squeezing beyond the last child's minimum size.
If set to `TRUE`, the squeezer can shrink to the point where no child can be shown. This is functionally equivalent to appending a widget with 0×0 minimum size.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

parameter.name: allow_none
parameter.parameter_description: whether @self allows squeezing beyond the last child

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_homogeneous
function.description:
Sets whether all children have the same size for the opposite orientation.
For example, if a squeezer is horizontal and is homogeneous, it will request the same height for all its children. If it isn't, the squeezer may change size when a different child becomes visible.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_interpolate_size
function.description:
Sets whether @self interpolates its size when changing the visible child.
If `TRUE`, the squeezer will interpolate its size between the one of the previous visible child and the one of the new visible child, according to the set transition duration and the orientation, e.g. if the squeezer is horizontal, it will interpolate the its height.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_switch_threshold_policy
function.description:
Sets the switch threshold policy for @self.
Determines when the squeezer will switch children.
If set to `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_MINIMUM`, it will only switch when the visible child cannot fit anymore. With `ADW_FOLD_THRESHOLD_POLICY_NATURAL`, it will switch as soon as the visible child doesn't get their natural size.
This can be useful if you have a long ellipsizing label and want to let it ellipsize instead of immediately switching.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_transition_duration
function.description:
Sets the transition animation duration for @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation used for transitions between children in @self.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_xalign
function.description:
Sets the horizontal alignment, from 0 (start) to 1 (end).
This affects the children allocation during transitions, when they exceed the size of the squeezer.
For example, 0.5 means the child will be centered, 0 means it will keep the start side aligned and overflow the end side, and 1 means the opposite.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_squeezer_set_yalign
function.description:
Sets the vertical alignment, from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).
This affects the children allocation during transitions, when they exceed the size of the squeezer.
For example, 0.5 means the child will be centered, 0 means it will keep the top side aligned and overflow the bottom side, and 1 means the opposite.
Deprecated: 1.4: See [the migration guide](migrating-to-breakpoints.html#replace-adwsqueezer)

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_accent_color
function.description:
Gets the current system accent color.
See also [property@StyleManager:accent-color-rgba].
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_accent_color_rgba
function.description:
Gets the current system accent color as a `GdkRGBA`.
Equivalent to calling [func@AccentColor.to_rgba] on the value of [property@StyleManager:accent-color].
This is a background color. The matching foreground color is white.
Since: 1.6

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_color_scheme
function.description: Gets the requested application color scheme.

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_dark
function.description:
Gets whether the application is using dark appearance.
This can be used to query the current appearance, as requested via [property@StyleManager:color-scheme].
function.return: whether the application is using dark appearance

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_default
function.description:
Gets the default `AdwStyleManager` instance.
It manages all [class@Gdk.Display] instances unless the style manager for that display has an override.
See [func@StyleManager.get_for_display].

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_display
function.description:
Gets the display the style manager is associated with.
The display will be `NULL` for the style manager returned by [func@StyleManager.get_default].

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_document_font_name
function.description:
Gets the system document font.
The font is in the same format as [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-font-name], e.g. "Adwaita Sans 11".
Use [func@Pango.FontDescription.from_string] to parse it.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_for_display
function.description:
Gets the `AdwStyleManager` instance managing @display.
It can be used to override styles for that specific display instead of the whole application.
Most applications should use [func@StyleManager.get_default] instead.

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_high_contrast
function.description:
Gets whether the application is using high contrast appearance.
This cannot be overridden by applications.
function.return: whether the application is using high contrast appearance

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_monospace_font_name
function.description:
Gets the system monospace font.
The font is in the same format as [property@Gtk.Settings:gtk-font-name], e.g. "Adwaita Mono 11".
Use [func@Pango.FontDescription.from_string] to parse it.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_system_supports_accent_colors
function.description:
Gets whether the system supports accent colors.
This can be used to check if the current environment provides an accent color preference. For example, applications might want to show a preference for choosing accent color if it's set to `FALSE`.
See [property@StyleManager:accent-color].
Since: 1.6
function.return: whether the system supports accent colors

function.name: adw_style_manager_get_system_supports_color_schemes
function.description:
Gets whether the system supports color schemes.
This can be used to check if the current environment provides a color scheme preference. For example, applications might want to show a separate appearance switcher if it's set to `FALSE`.
function.return: whether the system supports color schemes

function.name: adw_style_manager_set_color_scheme
function.description:
Sets the requested application color scheme.
The effective appearance will be decided based on the application color scheme and the system preferred color scheme. The [property@StyleManager:dark] property can be used to query the current effective appearance.
The `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_LIGHT` color scheme results in the application using light appearance unless the system prefers dark colors. This is the default value.
The `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_DARK` color scheme results in the application using dark appearance, but can still switch to the light appearance if the system can prefers it, for example, when the high contrast preference is enabled.
The `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_FORCE_LIGHT` and `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_FORCE_DARK` values ignore the system preference entirely. They are useful if the application wants to match its UI to its content or to provide a separate color scheme switcher.
If a per-[class@Gdk.Display] style manager has its color scheme set to `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_DEFAULT`, it will inherit the color scheme from the default style manager.
For the default style manager, `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_DEFAULT` is equivalent to `ADW_COLOR_SCHEME_PREFER_LIGHT`.
The [property@StyleManager:system-supports-color-schemes] property can be used to check if the current environment provides a color scheme preference.

function.name: adw_swipeable_get_swipe_area
function.description:
Gets the area @self can start a swipe from for the given direction and gesture type.
This can be used to restrict swipes to only be possible from a certain area, for example, to only allow edge swipes, or to have a draggable element and ignore swipes elsewhere.
If not implemented, the default implementation returns the allocation of @self, allowing swipes from anywhere.

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a rectangle to store the swipe area

Gets the parent page of @self.
See [method@TabView.add_page] and [method@TabView.close_page].

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_pinned
function.description:
Gets whether @self is pinned.
See [method@TabView.set_page_pinned].

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_selected
function.description: Gets whether @self is selected.

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_thumbnail_xalign
function.description:
Gets the horizontal alignment of the thumbnail for @self.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_thumbnail_yalign
function.description:
Gets the vertical alignment of the thumbnail for @self.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_title
function.description: Gets the title of @self.

function.name: adw_tab_page_get_tooltip
function.description: Gets the tooltip of @self.

function.name: adw_tab_page_invalidate_thumbnail
function.description:
Invalidates thumbnail for @self.
If an [class@TabOverview] is open, the thumbnail representing @self will be immediately updated. Otherwise it will be update when opening the overview.
Does nothing if [property@TabPage:live-thumbnail] is set to `TRUE`.
See also [method@TabView.invalidate_thumbnails].
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_icon
function.description:
Sets the icon of @self.
[class@TabBar] and [class@TabOverview] display the icon next to the title, unless [property@TabPage:loading] is set to `TRUE`.
`AdwTabBar` also won't show the icon if the page is pinned and [propertyTabPage:indicator-icon] is set.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_indicator_activatable
function.description:
Sets whether the indicator of @self is activatable.
If set to `TRUE`, [signal@TabView::indicator-activated] will be emitted when the indicator icon is clicked.
If [property@TabPage:indicator-icon] is not set, does nothing.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_indicator_icon
function.description:
Sets the indicator icon of @self.
A common use case is an audio or camera indicator in a web browser.
[class@TabBar] will show it at the beginning of the tab, alongside icon representing [property@TabPage:icon] or loading spinner.
If the page is pinned, the indicator will be shown instead of icon or spinner.
[class@TabOverview] will show it at the at the top part of the thumbnail.
[property@TabPage:indicator-tooltip] can be used to set the tooltip on the indicator icon.
If [property@TabPage:indicator-activatable] is set to `TRUE`, the indicator icon can act as a button.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_indicator_tooltip
function.description:
Sets the tooltip of the indicator icon of @self.
The tooltip can be marked up with the Pango text markup language.
See [property@TabPage:indicator-icon].
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_keyword
function.description:
Sets the search keyword for @self.
[class@TabOverview] can search pages by their keywords in addition to their titles and tooltips.
Keywords allow to include e.g. page URLs into tab search in a web browser.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_live_thumbnail
function.description:
Sets whether to enable live thumbnail for @self.
When set to `TRUE`, @self's thumbnail in [class@TabOverview] will update immediately when @self is redrawn or resized.
If it's set to `FALSE`, the thumbnail will only be live when the @self is selected, and otherwise it will be static and will only update when [method@TabPage.invalidate_thumbnail] or [method@TabView.invalidate_thumbnails] is called.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_loading
function.description:
Sets whether @self is loading.
If set to `TRUE`, [class@TabBar] and [class@TabOverview] will display a spinner in place of icon.
If the page is pinned and [property@TabPage:indicator-icon] is set, loading status will not be visible with `AdwTabBar`.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_needs_attention
function.description:
Sets whether @self needs attention.
[class@TabBar] will display a line under the tab representing the page if set to `TRUE`. If the tab is not visible, the corresponding edge of the tab bar will be highlighted.
[class@TabOverview] will display a dot in the corner of the thumbnail if set to `TRUE`.
[class@TabButton] will display a dot if any of the pages that aren't selected have [property@TabPage:needs-attention] set to `TRUE`.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_thumbnail_xalign
function.description:
Sets the horizontal alignment of the thumbnail for @self.
If the page is so wide that [class@TabOverview] can't display it completely and has to crop it, horizontal alignment will determine which part of the page will be visible.
For example, 0.5 means the center of the page will be visible, 0 means the start edge will be visible and 1 means the end edge will be visible.
The default horizontal alignment is 0.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_thumbnail_yalign
function.description:
Sets the vertical alignment of the thumbnail for @self.
If the page is so tall that [class@TabOverview] can't display it completely and has to crop it, vertical alignment will determine which part of the page will be visible.
For example, 0.5 means the center of the page will be visible, 0 means the top edge will be visible and 1 means the bottom edge will be visible.
The default vertical alignment is 0.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_title
function.description:
[class@TabBar] will display it in the center of the tab unless it's pinned, and will use it as a tooltip unless [property@TabPage:tooltip] is set.
[class@TabOverview] will display it below the thumbnail unless it's pinned, or inside the card otherwise, and will use it as a tooltip unless [property@TabPage:tooltip] is set.
Sets the title of @self.

function.name: adw_tab_page_set_tooltip
function.description:
Sets the tooltip of @self.
The tooltip can be marked up with the Pango text markup language.
If not set, [class@TabBar] and [class@TabOverview] will use [property@TabPage:title] as a tooltip instead.

function.name: adw_tab_view_add_page
function.description:
Adds @child to @self with @parent as the parent.
This function can be used to automatically position new pages, and to select the correct page when this page is closed while being selected (see [method@TabView.close_page]).
If @parent is `NULL`, this function is equivalent to [method@TabView.append].

function.name: adw_tab_view_add_shortcuts
function.description:
Adds @shortcuts for @self.
See [property@TabView:shortcuts] for details.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_tab_view_append
function.description: Inserts @child as the last non-pinned page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_append_pinned
function.description: Inserts @child as the last pinned page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_close_other_pages
function.description: Requests to close all pages other than @page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_close_page
function.description:
Requests to close @page.
Calling this function will result in the [signal@TabView::close-page] signal being emitted for @page. Closing the page can then be confirmed or denied via [method@TabView.close_page_finish].
If the page is waiting for a [method@TabView.close_page_finish] call, this function will do nothing.
The default handler for [signal@TabView::close-page] will immediately confirm closing the page if it's non-pinned, or reject it if it's pinned. This behavior can be changed by registering your own handler for that signal.
If @page was selected, another page will be selected instead:
If the [property@TabPage:parent] value is `NULL`, the next page will be selected when possible, or if the page was already last, the previous page will be selected instead.
If it's not `NULL`, the previous page will be selected if it's a descendant (possibly indirect) of the parent. If both the previous page and the parent are pinned, the parent will be selected instead.

function.name: adw_tab_view_close_page_finish
function.description:
Completes a [method@TabView.close_page] call for @page.
If @confirm is `TRUE`, @page will be closed. If it's `FALSE`, it will be reverted to its previous state and [method@TabView.close_page] can be called for it again.
This function should not be called unless a custom handler for [signal@TabView::close-page] is used.

parameter.name: confirm
parameter.parameter_description: whether to confirm or deny closing @page

function.name: adw_tab_view_close_pages_after
function.description: Requests to close all pages after @page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_close_pages_before
function.description: Requests to close all pages before @page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_default_icon
function.description: Gets the default icon of @self.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_is_transferring_page
function.description:
Whether a page is being transferred.
The corresponding property will be set to `TRUE` when a drag-n-drop tab transfer starts on any `AdwTabView`, and to `FALSE` after it ends.
During the transfer, children cannot receive pointer input and a tab can be safely dropped on the tab view.
function.return: whether a page is being transferred

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_menu_model
function.description: Gets the tab context menu model for @self.
function.return: the tab context menu model for @self

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_n_pages
function.description: Gets the number of pages in @self.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_n_pinned_pages
function.description:
Gets the number of pinned pages in @self.
See [method@TabView.set_page_pinned].
function.return: the number of pinned pages in @self

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_nth_page
function.description: Gets the [class@TabPage] representing the child at @position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the page in @self, starting from 0

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_page
function.description: Gets the [class@TabPage] object representing @child.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_page_position
function.description: Finds the position of @page in @self, starting from 0.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_pages
function.description:
Returns a [iface@Gio.ListModel] that contains the pages of @self.
This can be used to keep an up-to-date view. The model also implements [iface@Gtk.SelectionModel] and can be used to track and change the selected page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_selected_page
function.description: Gets the currently selected page in @self.

function.name: adw_tab_view_get_shortcuts
function.description:
Gets the enabled shortcuts for @self.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_tab_view_insert
function.description:
Inserts a non-pinned page at @position.
It's an error to try to insert a page before a pinned page, in that case [method@TabView.insert_pinned] should be used instead.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to add @child at, starting from 0

function.name: adw_tab_view_insert_pinned
function.description:
Inserts a pinned page at @position.
It's an error to try to insert a pinned page after a non-pinned page, in that case [method@TabView.insert] should be used instead.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to add @child at, starting from 0

function.name: adw_tab_view_invalidate_thumbnails
function.description:
Invalidates thumbnails for all pages in @self.
This is a convenience method, equivalent to calling [method@TabPage.invalidate_thumbnail] on each page.
Since: 1.3

function.name: adw_tab_view_new
function.description: Creates a new `AdwTabView`.

function.name: adw_tab_view_prepend
function.description: Inserts @child as the first non-pinned page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_prepend_pinned
function.description: Inserts @child as the first pinned page.

function.name: adw_tab_view_remove_shortcuts
function.description:
Removes @shortcuts from @self.
See [property@TabView:shortcuts] for details.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_tab_view_reorder_backward
function.description: Reorders @page to before its previous page if possible.

function.name: adw_tab_view_reorder_first
function.description: Reorders @page to the first possible position.

function.name: adw_tab_view_reorder_forward
function.description: Reorders @page to after its next page if possible.

function.name: adw_tab_view_reorder_last
function.description: Reorders @page to the last possible position.

function.name: adw_tab_view_reorder_page
function.description:
Reorders @page to @position.
It's a programmer error to try to reorder a pinned page after a non-pinned one, or a non-pinned page before a pinned one.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the page at, starting at 0

function.name: adw_tab_view_select_next_page
function.description:
Selects the page after the currently selected page.
If the last page was already selected, this function does nothing.
function.return: whether the selected page was changed

function.name: adw_tab_view_select_previous_page
function.description:
Selects the page before the currently selected page.
If the first page was already selected, this function does nothing.
function.return: whether the selected page was changed

function.name: adw_tab_view_set_default_icon
function.description:
Sets the default page icon for @self.
If a page doesn't provide its own icon via [property@TabPage:icon], a default icon may be used instead for contexts where having an icon is necessary.
[class@TabBar] will use default icon for pinned tabs in case the page is not loading, doesn't have an icon and an indicator. Default icon is never used for tabs that aren't pinned.
[class@TabOverview] will use default icon for pages with missing thumbnails.
By default, the `adw-tab-icon-missing-symbolic` icon is used.

function.name: adw_tab_view_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets the tab context menu model for @self.
When a context menu is shown for a tab, it will be constructed from the provided menu model. Use the [signal@TabView::setup-menu] signal to set up the menu actions for the particular tab.

function.name: adw_tab_view_set_page_pinned
function.description:
Pins or unpins @page.
Pinned pages are guaranteed to be placed before all non-pinned pages; at any given moment the first [property@TabView:n-pinned-pages] pages in @self are guaranteed to be pinned.
When a page is pinned or unpinned, it's automatically reordered: pinning a page moves it after other pinned pages; unpinning a page moves it before other non-pinned pages.
Pinned pages can still be reordered between each other.
[class@TabBar] will display pinned pages in a compact form, never showing the title or close button, and only showing a single icon, selected in the following order:
1. [property@TabPage:indicator-icon] 2. A spinner if [property@TabPage:loading] is `TRUE` 3. [property@TabPage:icon] 4. [property@TabView:default-icon]
[class@TabOverview] will not show a thumbnail for pinned pages, and replace the close button with an unpin button. Unlike `AdwTabBar`, it will still display the page's title, icon and indicator separately.
Pinned pages cannot be closed by default, see [signal@TabView::close-page] for how to override that behavior.
Changes the value of the [property@TabPage:pinned] property.

function.name: adw_tab_view_set_selected_page
function.description: Sets the currently selected page in @self.

function.name: adw_tab_view_set_shortcuts
function.description:
Sets the enabled shortcuts for @self.
See [flags@TabViewShortcuts] for the list of the available shortcuts. All of the shortcuts are enabled by default.
[method@TabView.add_shortcuts] and [method@TabView.remove_shortcuts] provide a convenient way to manage individual shortcuts.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_tab_view_transfer_page
function.description:
Transfers @page from @self to @other_view.
The @page object will be reused.
It's a programmer error to try to insert a pinned page after a non-pinned one, or a non-pinned page before a pinned one.

parameter.name: other_view
parameter.parameter_description: the tab view to transfer the page to

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the page at, starting at 0

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_alternate
function.description: Gets whether @self changes direction on every iteration.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_duration
function.description: Gets the duration of @self.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_easing
function.description: Gets the easing function @self uses.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_repeat_count
function.description: Gets the number of times @self will play.
function.return: the number of times @self will play

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_reverse
function.description: Gets whether @self plays backwards.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_value_from
function.description: Gets the value @self will animate from.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_get_value_to
function.description: Gets the value @self will animate to.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_new
function.description: Creates a new `AdwTimedAnimation` on @widget to animate @target from @from to @to.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to create animation on

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_alternate
function.description: Sets whether @self changes direction on every iteration.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_duration
function.description:
Sets the duration of @self.
If the animation repeats more than once, sets the duration of one iteration.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: the duration to use, in milliseconds

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_easing
function.description:
Sets the easing function @self will use.
See [enum@Easing] for the description of specific easing functions.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_repeat_count
function.description:
Sets the number of times @self will play.
If set to 0, @self will repeat endlessly.

parameter.name: repeat_count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of times @self will play

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_reverse
function.description: Sets whether @self plays backwards.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_value_from
function.description:
Sets the value @self will animate from.
The animation will start at this value and end at [property@TimedAnimation:value-to].
If [property@TimedAnimation:reverse] is `TRUE`, the animation will end at this value instead.

function.name: adw_timed_animation_set_value_to
function.description:
Sets the value @self will animate to.
The animation will start at [property@TimedAnimation:value-from] and end at this value.
If [property@TimedAnimation:reverse] is `TRUE`, the animation will start at this value instead.

function.name: adw_toast_dismiss
function.description:
Dismisses @self.
Does nothing if @self has already been dismissed, or hasn't been added to an [class@ToastOverlay].

function.name: adw_toast_get_action_name
function.description: Gets the name of the associated action.

function.name: adw_toast_get_action_target_value
function.description: Gets the parameter for action invocations.

function.name: adw_toast_get_button_label
function.description: Gets the label to show on the button.

function.name: adw_toast_get_custom_title
function.description:
Gets the custom title widget of @self.
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_toast_get_priority
function.description: Gets priority for @self.

function.name: adw_toast_get_timeout
function.description: Gets timeout for @self.

function.name: adw_toast_get_title
function.description:
Gets the title that will be displayed on the toast.
If a custom title has been set with [method@Adw.Toast.set_custom_title] the return value will be %NULL.

function.name: adw_toast_get_use_markup
function.description:
Gets whether to use Pango markup for the toast title.
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_toast_new
adw_toast_new_format
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwToast`.
The toast will use the format string as its title.
See also: [ctor@Toast.new]
Since: 1.2

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the formatted string for the toast title

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: the parameters to insert into the format string

function.name: adw_toast_overlay_add_toast
function.description:
Displays @toast.
Only one toast can be shown at a time; if a toast is already being displayed, either @toast or the original toast will be placed in a queue, depending on the priority of @toast. See [property@Toast:priority].
If called on a toast that's already displayed, its timeout will be reset.
If called on a toast currently in the queue, the toast will be bumped forward to be shown as soon as possible.

function.name: adw_toast_overlay_dismiss_all
function.description:
Dismisses all displayed toasts.
Use [method@Toast.dismiss] to dismiss a single toast.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toast_overlay_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @self.

function.name: adw_toast_overlay_new
function.description: Creates a new `AdwToastOverlay`.

function.name: adw_toast_overlay_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @self.

function.name: adw_toast_set_action_name
function.description:
Sets the name of the associated action.
It will be activated when clicking the button.
See [property@Toast:action-target].

function.name: adw_toast_set_action_target
function.description:
Sets the parameter for action invocations.
This is a convenience function that calls [ctor@GLib.Variant.new] for @format_string and uses the result to call [method@Toast.set_action_target_value].
If you are setting a string-valued target and want to set the action name at the same time, you can use [method@Toast.set_detailed_action_name].

function.name: adw_toast_set_action_target_value
function.description:
Sets the parameter for action invocations.
If the @action_target variant has a floating reference this function will sink it.

function.name: adw_toast_set_button_label
function.description:
Sets the label to show on the button.
Underlines in the button text can be used to indicate a mnemonic.
If set to `NULL`, the button won't be shown.
See [property@Toast:action-name].

function.name: adw_toast_set_custom_title
function.description:
Sets the custom title widget of @self.
It will be displayed instead of the title if set. In this case, [property@Toast:title] is ignored.
Setting a custom title will unset [property@Toast:title].
Since: 1.2

function.name: adw_toast_set_detailed_action_name
adw_toast_set_priority
function.description:
Sets priority for @self.
Priority controls how the toast behaves when another toast is already being displayed.
If @priority is `ADW_TOAST_PRIORITY_NORMAL`, the toast will be queued.
If @priority is `ADW_TOAST_PRIORITY_HIGH`, the toast will be displayed immediately, pushing the previous toast into the queue instead.

function.name: adw_toast_set_timeout
function.description:
Sets timeout for @self.
If @timeout is 0, the toast is displayed indefinitely until manually dismissed.
Toasts cannot disappear while being hovered, pressed (on touchscreen), or have keyboard focus inside them.

function.name: adw_toast_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title that will be displayed on the toast.
The title can be marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Setting a title will unset [property@Toast:custom-title].
If [property@Toast:custom-title] is set, it will be used instead.

function.name: adw_toast_set_use_markup
function.description:
Whether to use Pango markup for the toast title.
See also [func@Pango.parse_markup].
Since: 1.4

function.name: adw_toggle_get_child
function.description:
Gets the child widget of @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_enabled
function.description:
Gets whether @self is enabled.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the icon name of @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_index
function.description:
Gets the index of @self within its toggle group.
Since: 1.7
function.return: the index, or `GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION` if it's not in a group

function.name: adw_toggle_get_label
function.description:
Gets the label of @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_name
function.description:
Gets the name of @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_tooltip
function.description:
Gets the tooltip of @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_get_use_underline
function.description:
Gets whether @self uses underlines.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_add
function.description:
Adds a toggle to @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_active
function.description:
Gets the index of the active toggle in @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_active_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the active toggle in @self.
Can be `NULL` if the currently active toggle doesn't have a name.
See [property@Toggle:name].
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_can_shrink
function.description:
Gets whether the toggles can be smaller than the natural size of their contents.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Gets whether all toggles take the same size.
Since: 1.7
function.return: whether all toggles take the same size

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_n_toggles
function.description:
Gets the number of toggles within @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_toggle
function.description:
Gets the toggle with @index from @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_toggle_by_name
function.description:
Gets the toggle with the name @name from @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_get_toggles
function.description:
Returns a [iface@Gio.ListModel] that contains the toggles of the group.
This can be used to keep an up-to-date view. The model also implements [iface@Gtk.SelectionModel] and can be used to track and change the active toggle.

function.name: adw_toggle_group_new
function.description:
Creates a new `AdwToggleGroup`.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_remove
function.description:
Removes @toggle from @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_remove_all
function.description:
Removes all toggles from @self.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_set_active
function.description:
Sets the active toggle for @self.
If the index is larger than the number of toggles in @self, unsets the current active toggle.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_set_active_name
function.description:
Sets the active toggle for @self.
The name can be set via [property@Toggle:name].
If @name is `NULL`, unset the current active toggle instead.
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_set_can_shrink
function.description:
Sets whether the toggles can be smaller than the natural size of their contents.
If @can_shrink is `TRUE`, the toggle labels will ellipsize.
See [property@Gtk.Button:can-shrink].
Since: 1.7

function.name: adw_toggle_group_set_homogeneous
function.description:
Sets whether all toggles take the same size.
Since: 1.7

function.description:
